commit_message:
Added SugarCRM application package

This package deploys the version 6.5.22 of SugarCRM CE.
SugarCRM is a customer relationship management software. Its Community
Edition is opensourced and is distributed under a GNU Affero General
Public License.
See README for more details.

Change-Id: I88c41b9b1af59a3282403f505184296da03bb969

subject: Bagpipe driver: use Neutron registry not an ML2 MD
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-09-08 16:07:18.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/neutron/db/bgpvpn_db.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/ml2_mech_driver.py', 'README-bagpipe.rst', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/bagpipe.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Bagpipe driver: use Neutron registry not an ML2 MD

This change makes the bagpipe driver use the Neutron
registry callbacks instead of a custom ML2 mech driver.

The now obsolete bgpvpn_notify mech driver still exists
to avoid breaking past configs, but it is empty and logs
a warning on startup.

With this change, the bagpipe driver also stops
preventing network deletion, because without a mech driver
we can't, which is good since it fixes bug 1489881.

This change also changes the behavior to ignore DHCP ports.

Implements: blueprint bagpipe-use-neutron-registry
Closes-Bug: 1489881
Partial-Bug: 1492349
Change-Id: I0dcfbadd222ad1f9768f4546118cb311fbfbdb51
"}]
commit_message:
Bagpipe driver: use Neutron registry not an ML2 MD

This change makes the bagpipe driver use the Neutron
registry callbacks instead of a custom ML2 mech driver.

The now obsolete bgpvpn_notify mech driver still exists
to avoid breaking past configs, but it is empty and logs
a warning on startup.

With this change, the bagpipe driver also stops
preventing network deletion, because without a mech driver
we can't, which is good since it fixes bug 1489881.

This change also changes the behavior to ignore DHCP ports.

Implements: blueprint bagpipe-use-neutron-registry
Closes-Bug: 1489881
Partial-Bug: 1492349
Change-Id: I0dcfbadd222ad1f9768f4546118cb311fbfbdb51

commit_message:
Remove address scopes from supported extensions

This feature is not ready for prime time, but the cli code is
already landed and shipped.

In order to prevent users from getting mad about an uncooked feature,
let's disable it until it becomes more robust.

Tests must be disabled unconditionally because our CI API test framework
execute tests for 'all' extensions available.

Related-blueprint: address-scopes

Change-Id: I71dc333e210b1f4acf30569711b4442ed8a1dfc3

commit_message:
Use novaclient.client.Client for initialization Nova client

`novaclient.client.Client` is a recommended entry point for novaclient.
It supports backward-compatibility and allows Nova-folks to change
interfaces of inner versioned clients classes.

Change-Id: Iaf20714f63c307f88a451759f041ca509fbcf6f8

There are some situations:
1. User can run the command "heat hook-clear" on any
resource in the stack, even if there is no hook
defined on it, and no error or warning message is returned.
2. User run the command "heat hook-clear" on resource
to clear the hook which resource unset, and no error or
warning message is returned.
3. User run the command "heat hook-clear" on resource
even if the resource's action is not support to signal, and
no error or warning message is returned.
4. User run the command "heat hook-clear" to clear invalid
hooks, and no error or warnning message is returned.

This patch will check the situations above before call
resource.signal, and will return error messages to user.

Closes-Bug: #1472515

commit_message:
Return error message if validate fail when clearing hook

There are some situations:
1. User can run the command "heat hook-clear" on any
resource in the stack, even if there is no hook
defined on it, and no error or warning message is returned.
2. User run the command "heat hook-clear" on resource
to clear the hook which resource unset, and no error or
warning message is returned.
3. User run the command "heat hook-clear" on resource
even if the resource's action is not support to signal, and
no error or warning message is returned.
4. User run the command "heat hook-clear" to clear invalid
hooks, and no error or warnning message is returned.

This patch will check the situations above before call
resource.signal, and will return error messages to user.

Change-Id: Ifb9befad864ebe1bb5f8b419b95d1b3a95530573
Closes-Bug: #1472515

I found that ip rules would be added multiple times in new address
scopes code because the _exists method was unable to reliably
determine if the rule already existed.  This commit improves this by
more robustly canonicalizing what it reads from the ip rule command so
that like rules always compare the same.

commit_message:
Make ip rule comparison more robust

I found that ip rules would be added multiple times in new address
scopes code because the _exists method was unable to reliably
determine if the rule already existed.  This commit improves this by
more robustly canonicalizing what it reads from the ip rule command so
that like rules always compare the same.

Change-Id: I6d0c208f0ed8e65cdb750789321a7ad6ca1b77c2
Partially-Implements: blueprint address-scopes

commit_message:

This reverts commit e424af2236ed1d6e6d0e11768f873ffe4e696221.

Splitting command strings that were previously assumed to be interpreted
by the shell at whitespace and then passing them as separate args to
execvp will not work.

subject: Fix heat cfn tools command injection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-04 12:50:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat_cfntools/cfntools/cfn_helper.py', 'heat_cfntools/tests/test_cfn_helper.py'], 'message': 'Fix heat cfn tools command injection

The command runner used String.split() method to convert the command to
list before passing it to subprocess for execution. This was required
to avoid any CLI injection.

The string.split() is not good enough as it causes the commands having
space-separated arguments to be further split, it does not honour the
space-separated arguments passed to command.

    "echo 'some day'".split() -> ['echo', "'some", "day'"]

There is shlex library meant for this purpose, it would split the
command so that it can be passed to subprocess and executed. It retains
the space separated arguments safely.

    shlex.split("echo 'some day'") -> ['echo', 'some day']

It works in our favor if we retain the commands as string and use
shlex's split to convert it to a list:

1. The cfn-hup allows external command to be passed as "action" via the
hooks.conf file. This action can be any arbitrary command and there is
no way to impose any restriction on type. The commands are written in
hooks.conf, as they would be on shell, and cfn-hup has to just read the
command and execute it as a user.

2. It is probably easier to write the commands as string than as list,
like typing on a shell.

Change-Id: If5f83f720c759ce8b8f6ab7ceb408f0769974ea2
Closes-Bug: #1312246
'}]
commit_message:
Fix heat cfn tools command injection

The command runner used String.split() method to convert the command to
list before passing it to subprocess for execution. This was required
to avoid any CLI injection.

The string.split() is not good enough as it causes the commands having
space-separated arguments to be further split, it does not honour the
space-separated arguments passed to command.

    "echo 'some day'".split() -> ['echo', "'some", "day'"]

There is shlex library meant for this purpose, it would split the
command so that it can be passed to subprocess and executed. It retains
the space separated arguments safely.

    shlex.split("echo 'some day'") -> ['echo', 'some day']

It works in our favor if we retain the commands as string and use
shlex's split to convert it to a list:

1. The cfn-hup allows external command to be passed as "action" via the
hooks.conf file. This action can be any arbitrary command and there is
no way to impose any restriction on type. The commands are written in
hooks.conf, as they would be on shell, and cfn-hup has to just read the
command and execute it as a user.

2. It is probably easier to write the commands as string than as list,
like typing on a shell.

Change-Id: If5f83f720c759ce8b8f6ab7ceb408f0769974ea2
Closes-Bug: #1312246

During development of the project quotas, I discovered that transport keys
are defined one per plugin.  They can not be created or deleted by a
project admin.  As such, quotas should not and can not apply to transport
keys.  Some stray snippets of transport key quota key leaked into the
commits.  This commit removes them.

Change-Id: I6f81fceec780c941dc7f731d02a8d6fe5d5fff40
Relates-to: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Vestigial Transport Key Quota Code

During development of the project quotas, I discovered that transport keys
are defined one per plugin.  They can not be created or deleted by a
project admin.  As such, quotas should not and can not apply to transport
keys.  Some stray snippets of transport key quota key leaked into the
commits.  This commit removes them.

Change-Id: I6f81fceec780c941dc7f731d02a8d6fe5d5fff40
Relates-to: blueprint quota-support-on-barbican-resources

This option provides another way to attach to a specific bridge
that is not quite equivalent with how bridge_mappings work in the
L2 agent. This creates inconsistencies between how the L3 agent
behaves when configured with a bridge_mapping and provider properties
of the Neutron network vs. when it just ignores all L2 stuff and

'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate external_network_bridge option in L3 agent

This option provides another way to attach to a specific bridge
that is not quite equivalent with how bridge_mappings work in the
L2 agent. This creates inconsistencies between how the L3 agent
behaves when configured with a bridge_mapping and provider properties
of the Neutron network vs. when it just ignores all L2 stuff and
plugs itself directly into the bridge.

See the bug report for more info.

Change-Id: I37de3cd6eaaf34856fa72753f471f4f0a9381836
Closes-Bug: #1491668

subject: Adds the ability to provide user certificates to HAProxy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-09 23:35:19.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/handlers/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_ssl_key_create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_ssl_configuration.yml'], 'message': "Adds the ability to provide user certificates to HAProxy

This change brings similar changes as this one targeting horizon:

i.e.:
* The server key/certificate (and optionally a CA cert) are
  distributed to all haproxy containers.

* Two new variables have been implemented for a user-provided
  server key and certificate:
  - haproxy_user_ssl_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>
  - haproxy_user_ssl_key: <path to cert on deployment host>
  If either of these is not defined, then the missing cert/key
  will be self generated on each container. No distribution
  of the self generated certificates accross all the hosts
  is planned.

* A new variable has been implemented for a user-provided CA
  certificate:
  - haproxy_user_ssl_ca_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>

* The 'haproxy_cert_regen' variable has been renamed
  to 'haproxy_ssl_self_signed_regen' to have the same
  naming convention as horizon.

* A change of certificates, whether user dropped
  or role generated, triggers pem generation and server restart

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1487380

Change-Id: I0c88d197d8ede820ac4e0388e67a2da06b003c2b
(cherry picked from commit 422a5b1e0fde667e7e9e7dd66bd3a8c6f2b9beb3)
"}]
commit_message:
Adds the ability to provide user certificates to HAProxy

This change brings similar changes as this one targeting horizon:

i.e.:
* The server key/certificate (and optionally a CA cert) are
  distributed to all haproxy containers.

* Two new variables have been implemented for a user-provided
  server key and certificate:
  - haproxy_user_ssl_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>
  - haproxy_user_ssl_key: <path to cert on deployment host>
  If either of these is not defined, then the missing cert/key
  will be self generated on each container. No distribution
  of the self generated certificates accross all the hosts
  is planned.

* A new variable has been implemented for a user-provided CA
  certificate:
  - haproxy_user_ssl_ca_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>

* The 'haproxy_cert_regen' variable has been renamed
  to 'haproxy_ssl_self_signed_regen' to have the same
  naming convention as horizon.

* A change of certificates, whether user dropped
  or role generated, triggers pem generation and server restart

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1487380

Change-Id: I0c88d197d8ede820ac4e0388e67a2da06b003c2b
(cherry picked from commit 422a5b1e0fde667e7e9e7dd66bd3a8c6f2b9beb3)

commit_message:
health manager service

This model is used to check amphora health
Add a column 'busy' and primary key  for data table amphora health
Add mutiprocessing code in cmd/health_manager, one for health check, the other is for UDP pacakge listening,

Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: min wang <swiftwangster@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint health-manager

commit_message:
Adding amphora failover flows

Added a flow to complete automated failover for an amphora.  Added new tasks
to retrieve ports, change port device ids for re-allocating to new amphora,
and added functionality to include existing ports on amphora creation.

Co-Authored-By: Brandon Logan <brandon.logan@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ic0d3f2b9a48ebf66df78e1ef98aef92ad7ee5057

commit_message:
Fix keystone shibboleth template to detect ssl usage correctly

In https://review.openstack.org/194474 the variable keystone_ssl_enabled
was changed to keystone_ssl, but the shibboleth.xml template was missed
in the change.

This patch corrects that.

Change-Id: I8248d01f37d35ddc910d06a4295760ea8924971d

commit_message:
Add compass to OpenStack projects

Compass is currently on Stackforge. We'd like to move it to openstack.

Compass provides automated deployment and management of hardware and software
systems running OpenStack, or other distributed systems. It has 3 core repos:
compass-core, compass-adapters, and compass-web.

Compass-core provides is the main layers in Compass systems. It provides
extensibility through adapters(or plugins). compass-adapters repo contains
Ansible or Chef cookbooks and other adapter related configs. compass-web
is a pure javascript-based web application that is built with AngularJS.

Depends-On: I6aacbf1e5bc295757d20d44ce6f4c8db23da1bfc
Change-Id: I014f2aa748fb12074c880ffd30f6517ae5e2fbb0

commit_message:
Fix drop of config values supplied by end user

This commit adds code to ensure that the values supplied by end
user for 'config' argument is not dropped in the create_vnf()
method. This scenario occurs in the case where end user supplies
values for both the 'config' and 'param-file' arguments.

commit_message:
Use a tiny connection wrapper in the heartbeat thread

Instead of directly using the os module in the agent module
have the utility module contain a connection class (that is
very similar to the multiprocess.connection.Connection
class) that wraps the operations used; allowing them to be
abstracted away from the underlying os operations.

Change-Id: I3f8a4bd71d69402a0326fa352bb3a775913446fc

subject: Set the Ubuntu mirror used based on the environment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 09:35:46.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': "Set the Ubuntu mirror used based on the environment

Apt updates/installs are the most common cause of build timeouts
within HP Cloud gate checks.

This patch changes both the AIO and the gate check from using the
Rackspace Ubuntu mirror for everything to:

1) The AIO bootstrap will use whichever mirror is already defined
   on the host operating system.

2) The gate check will use a known mirror which is defined per
   cloud provider. If the cloud provider is not known, or the
   script is being used outside of OpenStack-CI, then the gate
   checkwill fall back to using the AIO's mechanism.

The idea is to make use of an apt mirror that is as close to the
instance as possible in order to speed up apt updates and installs.

Closes-Bug: #1491749
Change-Id: Ia37100bc198b64b74f27ea98ec5956e7cf084883
(cherry picked from commit b940e7b7de75bb0842ee36330e69103a98bd3a14)
"}]
commit_message:
Set the Ubuntu mirror used based on the environment

Apt updates/installs are the most common cause of build timeouts
within HP Cloud gate checks.

This patch changes both the AIO and the gate check from using the
Rackspace Ubuntu mirror for everything to:

1) The AIO bootstrap will use whichever mirror is already defined
   on the host operating system.

2) The gate check will use a known mirror which is defined per
   cloud provider. If the cloud provider is not known, or the
   script is being used outside of OpenStack-CI, then the gate
   checkwill fall back to using the AIO's mechanism.

The idea is to make use of an apt mirror that is as close to the
instance as possible in order to speed up apt updates and installs.

Closes-Bug: #1491749
Change-Id: Ia37100bc198b64b74f27ea98ec5956e7cf084883
(cherry picked from commit b940e7b7de75bb0842ee36330e69103a98bd3a14)

enable_tuskar was only getting toggled to false in the sample
undercloud.conf which has no effect when the undercloud installer is
actually run. This change copies the sample file to the stack user's
home directory, and sets enable_tuskar=false there instead so it takes

Change-Id: I8a525a07d183c6a0b40d2ab11dd1148f1de93280

commit_message:
Fix tuskar-ui disablement

enable_tuskar was only getting toggled to false in the sample
undercloud.conf which has no effect when the undercloud installer is
actually run. This change copies the sample file to the stack user's
home directory, and sets enable_tuskar=false there instead so it takes
effect.

Change-Id: I8a525a07d183c6a0b40d2ab11dd1148f1de93280

commit_message:
puppet-openstack/zuul-layout: make voting more ubuntu beaker jobs

Canonical released today OpenStack 'b2' which is packaged in 'proposed'
UCA repository.
The repository is stable enough to consume it from Puppet OpenStack CI
instead of painful Liberty Staging repo which is broken all the time.

This patch aims to re-enabling voting for all beaker jobs running on
Ubuntu except for Ironic where there is still issues with the package.
In the meantime it's being fixed, let's make it non-voting.

Change-Id: I08bb30bbd71ac083d24ca30607fc7e319dee21eb

subject: Added the support of Glance Artifact Repository
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-09-09 19:15:25.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/package_loader.py', 'murano/common/config.py', 'murano/engine/client_manager.py', 'murano/dsl/helpers.py', 'contrib/plugins/murano_exampleplugin/murano_exampleplugin/cfg.py'], 'message': 'Added the support of Glance Artifact Repository

Murano's application packages can now be stored either in database
(using murano-api) or in Glance Artifact repository (so-called Glance
V3 api). This patch adds an experimental support of the latter
approach to murano engine.

As all the difference between these two storages is incapsulated in
the murano client, engine just needs to configure it properly by
passing an instance of glance v3 client on creation. This is
controlled by a 'packages_service' parameter of 'packages_opts'
configuration group. It is set to 'murano' by default and indicates
the usage of old, database-backed storage. If set to 'glance', the
murano client will encapsulate glance v3 connector and thus the
packages will be accessed from Glance Artifact Repository.

The settings of Glance client are also added to the configuration, as
well as a client factory to generate the client. As these settings may
now conflict with the settings "demo plugin", the appropriate
configuration section is renamed in the latter.

This patch also contains a couple of utility functions to transform
partial semver version specs into non-partial ones and - further - to
a set of Glance query parameters needed to filter the artifacts based
on that spec.

Change-Id: I690467e43b6b63850ebecef756635241e623554c
Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository-support
'}]
commit_message:
Added the support of Glance Artifact Repository

Murano's application packages can now be stored either in database
(using murano-api) or in Glance Artifact repository (so-called Glance
V3 api). This patch adds an experimental support of the latter
approach to murano engine.

As all the difference between these two storages is incapsulated in
the murano client, engine just needs to configure it properly by
passing an instance of glance v3 client on creation. This is
controlled by a 'packages_service' parameter of 'packages_opts'
configuration group. It is set to 'murano' by default and indicates
the usage of old, database-backed storage. If set to 'glance', the
murano client will encapsulate glance v3 connector and thus the
packages will be accessed from Glance Artifact Repository.

The settings of Glance client are also added to the configuration, as
well as a client factory to generate the client. As these settings may
now conflict with the settings "demo plugin", the appropriate
configuration section is renamed in the latter.

This patch also contains a couple of utility functions to transform
partial semver version specs into non-partial ones and - further - to
a set of Glance query parameters needed to filter the artifacts based
on that spec.

Change-Id: I690467e43b6b63850ebecef756635241e623554c
Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository-support

commit_message:
ldappool is only python-2.7

The ldappool library is only used with python-2.7 as it requires
python-ldap to work. This library will also not be required once
keystone moves to the new ldap3 library.

Change-Id: I6fba91188efa68256d0bf470f01eee03de911e35

commit_message:
Only add roles for enabled services

If a the tempest account generator script takes a role from a service
that's disabled in configuration then we shouldn't expect the roles
to exist. This commit addresses this by checking the if the service is
enabled before attempting to add the roles.

Change-Id: Ic797fbc05d58e7f5af323ad7741546ced97754d2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 15:00:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py', 'neutron/policy.py', 'etc/policy.json'], 'message': "Stop device_owner from being set to 'network:*'

This patch adjusts the FieldCheck class in the policy engine to
allow a regex rule. It then leverages that to prevent users from
setting the device_owner field to anything that starts with
'network:' on networks which they do not own.

This policy adjustment is necessary because any ports with a
device_owner that starts with 'network:' will not have any security
group rules applied because it is assumed they are trusted network
devices (e.g. router ports, DHCP ports, etc). These security rules
include the anti-spoofing protection for DHCP, IPv6 ICMP messages,
and IP headers.

Without this policy adjustment, tenants can abuse this trust when
connected to a shared network with other tenants by setting their
VM port's device_owner field to 'network:<anything>' and hijack other
tenants' traffic via DHCP spoofing or MAC/IP spoofing.

Conflicts:
	etc/policy.json
	neutron/api/v2/attributes.py
	neutron/tests/etc/policy.json
	neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py

Closes-Bug: #1489111
Change-Id: Ia64cf16142e0e4be44b5b0ed72c8e00792d770f9
(cherry picked from commit 959a2f28cbbfc309381ea9ffb55090da6fb9c78f)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop device_owner from being set to 'network:*'

This patch adjusts the FieldCheck class in the policy engine to
allow a regex rule. It then leverages that to prevent users from
setting the device_owner field to anything that starts with
'network:' on networks which they do not own.

This policy adjustment is necessary because any ports with a
device_owner that starts with 'network:' will not have any security
group rules applied because it is assumed they are trusted network
devices (e.g. router ports, DHCP ports, etc). These security rules
include the anti-spoofing protection for DHCP, IPv6 ICMP messages,
and IP headers.

Without this policy adjustment, tenants can abuse this trust when
connected to a shared network with other tenants by setting their
VM port's device_owner field to 'network:<anything>' and hijack other
tenants' traffic via DHCP spoofing or MAC/IP spoofing.

Conflicts:
	etc/policy.json
	neutron/api/v2/attributes.py
	neutron/tests/etc/policy.json
	neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py

Closes-Bug: #1489111
Change-Id: Ia64cf16142e0e4be44b5b0ed72c8e00792d770f9
(cherry picked from commit 959a2f28cbbfc309381ea9ffb55090da6fb9c78f)

subject: Ensure datasources are properly deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-09 16:16:28.000000000', 'files': ['congress/dse/d6cage.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py'], 'message': 'Ensure datasources are properly deleted

Previously, deleting a datasource driver did not remove it from the DSE.
That was caused by the polling thread having a reference to the object
it was polling and therefore the object was not properly garbage
collected upon deletion.

This change deletes the polling thread and then deletes the object,
which allows garbage collection to properly eliminate the datasource.

Change-Id: I8063dab0786e7c728ba0c0c9b3cc33748f70a38c
Closes-bug: 1493430
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure datasources are properly deleted

Previously, deleting a datasource driver did not remove it from the DSE.
That was caused by the polling thread having a reference to the object
it was polling and therefore the object was not properly garbage
collected upon deletion.

This change deletes the polling thread and then deletes the object,
which allows garbage collection to properly eliminate the datasource.

Change-Id: I8063dab0786e7c728ba0c0c9b3cc33748f70a38c
Closes-bug: 1493430

commit_message:
Tempest: add a Cinder extend_with_snapshot feature flag

A new tempest test is being added in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/200108/
but it doesn't run by default because the test fails on Juno. So a
feature flag in Tempest is added. This patch turns on this feature
flag at Devstack's side.

Change-Id: If1cf90dac3edc81a483fc51da74495042c96d543

subject: Replace metaclass registry with explicit opt-in registry from oslo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 21:39:27.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/objects/node.py', 'ironic/objects/conductor.py', 'ironic/tests/objects/test_objects.py', 'ironic/objects/chassis.py', 'ironic/tests/base.py', 'ironic/objects/port.py', 'ironic/objects/base.py'], 'message': 'Replace metaclass registry with explicit opt-in registry from oslo

This moves Ironic from the legacy metaclass-based registry (as copied
from nova long ago) to the olso registry structure where classes are
registered by decorator. This includes registering some test-only classes,
which use the register_if(False) scheme to do the object-building step,
but without actually inserting the class into the registry. This prevents
those test classes from ever being registered at runtime by accident
(and thus send/receive-able over RPC).

Change-Id: If05610f8570686678f752f0bd141a608a4bfe641
Related-Bug: #1461239
'}]
commit_message:
Replace metaclass registry with explicit opt-in registry from oslo

This moves Ironic from the legacy metaclass-based registry (as copied
from nova long ago) to the olso registry structure where classes are
registered by decorator. This includes registering some test-only classes,
which use the register_if(False) scheme to do the object-building step,
but without actually inserting the class into the registry. This prevents
those test classes from ever being registered at runtime by accident
(and thus send/receive-able over RPC).

Change-Id: If05610f8570686678f752f0bd141a608a4bfe641
Related-Bug: #1461239

revisions:

This patch adds a new --detailed-exit-codes option which can
be used to optionally enable the os-net-config CLI to return
exit code 2 if there have been modifications. Detailed
exit codes are useful if you need to trigger subsequent
external actions based whether os-net-config made changes or not.

Change-Id: I8f22fa15335d1276f4e444a6454a24ff486e1495
'}]
commit_message:
Add --detailed-exit-codes

This patch adds a new --detailed-exit-codes option which can
be used to optionally enable the os-net-config CLI to return
exit code 2 if there have been modifications. Detailed
exit codes are useful if you need to trigger subsequent
external actions based whether os-net-config made changes or not.

Change-Id: I8f22fa15335d1276f4e444a6454a24ff486e1495

commit_message:
Revert "Adding back exception mapping for ConnectionError"

This reverts commit c45fd909c37eabe6e3391304f539003aa3bbff2d.

This change defined ConnectionError = ConnectionRefused, but
there's already a class ConnectionError defined, so the new
ConnectionError is masking the original ConnectionError.

Change-Id: Idf6ffa59e2db39e0e1980bff1d8ad5861b0bfd16

commit_message:
Implement reset-state for attach_status and migration_status

Currently the reset-state command in the client only handles
the main volume status column. This adds options to set
attach_status and to reset migration_status.

DocImpact: Add new options to cinder reset-state command
Change-Id: Ifaa04c2f8a7ff21100f7c9c51df881313e8babea
Closes-Bug: #1309086

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-05 19:25:50.000000000', 'files': ['etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters'], 'message': "Add os-brick's scsi_id command to rootwrap

Fibre channel drivers are failing on calls from the
os-brick library to scsi_id.

This is a temporary fix until os-brick's rootwrap
filters can be pulled in. It is not intended or
desired that nova track all os-brick rootwrap filter
values. But until that mechanism is finalized, we
need necessary commands added here.

Change-Id: Ie5f1fbe0a2da171d80faefe3245df91aef8ce1ab
Partial-bug: #1479842
"}]
commit_message:
Add os-brick's scsi_id command to rootwrap

Fibre channel drivers are failing on calls from the
os-brick library to scsi_id.

This is a temporary fix until os-brick's rootwrap
filters can be pulled in. It is not intended or
desired that nova track all os-brick rootwrap filter
values. But until that mechanism is finalized, we
need necessary commands added here.

Change-Id: Ie5f1fbe0a2da171d80faefe3245df91aef8ce1ab
Partial-bug: #1479842

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-09 13:27:15.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Add version hashes to enforce version updates

Nova uses a map of hashes for important parts of versioned objects. It
keeps a static mapping of previous objects, and generates a map of the
current objects. If these differ, a test fails, enforcing that the hash
of the object needs to be updated. Along with this, it usually means
that the version of the object itself needs to be updated because the
RPC contract of that object is now broken.

oslo_versionedobjects contains a fixture for helping generate and test
these hashes, so this fixture is used to test Magnum's object hashes.

Change-Id: I586f73570dc7b65c83b216d09d11e8dba3c63b2c
Closes-Bug: #1491855
"}]
commit_message:
Add version hashes to enforce version updates

Nova uses a map of hashes for important parts of versioned objects. It
keeps a static mapping of previous objects, and generates a map of the
current objects. If these differ, a test fails, enforcing that the hash
of the object needs to be updated. Along with this, it usually means
that the version of the object itself needs to be updated because the
RPC contract of that object is now broken.

oslo_versionedobjects contains a fixture for helping generate and test
these hashes, so this fixture is used to test Magnum's object hashes.

Change-Id: I586f73570dc7b65c83b216d09d11e8dba3c63b2c
Closes-Bug: #1491855

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 13:11:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/image/test_glance.py', 'cinder/image/glance.py'], 'message': "Fix volume creation from image with allowed_direct_url_schemes

When CONF.allowed_direct_url_schemes is set to ['file'] and
Glance image has direct_url or locations metadata with 'file:///'
scheme, cinder tries to directly read the image data from the
local file. However, currently the code is broken because return

This fixes the code so that it can handle the metadata correctly.

Change-Id: I39a12a31fbfbd3a9824c67391096f74406d8a749
Closes-Bug: #1437477
(cherry picked from commit 181be53a2b0a54f7b4cd33dacbaa560e124e9421)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volume creation from image with allowed_direct_url_schemes

When CONF.allowed_direct_url_schemes is set to ['file'] and
Glance image has direct_url or locations metadata with 'file:///'
scheme, cinder tries to directly read the image data from the
local file. However, currently the code is broken because return
value from get_location() has been changed to a tuple.
This fixes the code so that it can handle the metadata correctly.

Change-Id: I39a12a31fbfbd3a9824c67391096f74406d8a749
Closes-Bug: #1437477
(cherry picked from commit 181be53a2b0a54f7b4cd33dacbaa560e124e9421)

commit_message:
Fix the heat stack user create

The heat stack user was being using the openstack cli tools. This has
changed such that its now using our library. This will ensure that the
roles, users, groups, projects, domains are created properly without
the variability of the CLI interface and returned data.

Closes-Bug: #1489947
Change-Id: I3f0af0589825fa506e3618f6f39a54bf89c87d14

subject: Create log configuration class
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-26 10:23:53.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/test_shell.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_context.py', 'openstackclient/common/context.py'], 'message': 'Create log configuration class

Configuration of logging gets triggered twice.  The first time it
uses the CLI options when the application is started and second
it uses the configuration file after that is read.  The state of
the logging needs to be saved from the first to the second time,
so I created a class.

Implements: blueprint logging-migration

Change-Id: I7b8d1a3b6fd128e98cafd7c16009c7b694a52146

commit_message:
Create log configuration class

Configuration of logging gets triggered twice.  The first time it
uses the CLI options when the application is started and second
it uses the configuration file after that is read.  The state of
the logging needs to be saved from the first to the second time,
so I created a class.

Implements: blueprint logging-migration

Change-Id: I7b8d1a3b6fd128e98cafd7c16009c7b694a52146

commit_message:

which allows to debug services from IDE.

subject: Optimize log formatting
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-13 22:16:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/common/test_context.py', 'openstackclient/common/context.py'], 'message': "Optimize log formatting

There is no way to change the configuration variables we want
printed in log messages, so format them in the constructor.
This will save us from overridding the format method and
a couple cpu cycles every log message.  This change also moves
the _LOG* variables into the formatter since they aren't really
globally needed.

Change-Id: I706e9db7da3daec20332f9d1533fe665f2739dea
Implements: blueprint logging-migration
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize log formatting

There is no way to change the configuration variables we want
printed in log messages, so format them in the constructor.
This will save us from overridding the format method and
a couple cpu cycles every log message.  This change also moves
the _LOG* variables into the formatter since they aren't really
globally needed.

Change-Id: I706e9db7da3daec20332f9d1533fe665f2739dea
Implements: blueprint logging-migration

subject: Extract log level from configuration file
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-13 22:16:03.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/common/test_context.py', 'openstackclient/common/context.py'], 'message': 'Extract log level from configuration file

Extract log_level from configuration file if the level was not
overridden by the command line option.  The default command line
option is 1 and there is no command line option to set the
verbose_level to 1, so if it is 1, it has not be set.

Change-Id: I1be04367c72f83c1181f92ca4c2c83165b66995c
Implements: blueprint logging-migration
'}]
commit_message:
Extract log level from configuration file

Extract log_level from configuration file if the level was not
overridden by the command line option.  The default command line
option is 1 and there is no command line option to set the
verbose_level to 1, so if it is 1, it has not be set.

Change-Id: I1be04367c72f83c1181f92ca4c2c83165b66995c
Implements: blueprint logging-migration

Users now can set architecture for target node and flavor by adding
IRONIC_HW_ARCH in the local.conf file. The option defaults to x86_64

Also uses CIRROS_ARCH variable to the ironic images as it's already used
in regular builds where libvirt is the virt driver.

Change-Id: Ib9e878c256c77ca8c6f39a7a3d48381b68cb0adf

commit_message:
Enables the user to set arch for the baremetal flavor and ironic node

Users now can set architecture for target node and flavor by adding
IRONIC_HW_ARCH in the local.conf file. The option defaults to x86_64

Also uses CIRROS_ARCH variable to the ironic images as it's already used
in regular builds where libvirt is the virt driver.

Change-Id: Ib9e878c256c77ca8c6f39a7a3d48381b68cb0adf

commit_message:
Retry if Swift objects are not available yet

Swift objects may not be immediately available after creation due to
Swift consistency issues.  Check if the objects are being returned and
retry if not.

Change-Id: I499389940a06965d213fcec458dfa388af47231e
Closes-Bug: #1493522

the internal conn.switch() and conn.get_relays()

commit_message:
Add retry options to iBoot power driver

This patch adds two new iBoot specific options to
facilitate a max_retry and retry_interval around
the internal conn.switch() and conn.get_relays()
functions. This should help avoid provisioning
failures if there is any sort of network blip
or failure that may occasionally cause an iboot
command to fail.

Change-Id: I3b7813ae56dd3b18008f814cd6272d801dd6f274
Closes-bug: #1490760

commit_message:
Do not override ENABLED_SERVICES in gate_hook

This variable should not be overridden, otherwise it is impossible
to enable other services on cue gates.

commit_message:

commit_message:
Fix initial value for the 'name' field

'name' field is inserted automatically if ui definition has 2.2
version of higher.
If ui definitions were nested, name for parent app was used.
This happend since list of filed were not cleaned up from the previous time.

Also, some improvement was made: initial value is not get from the application section,
but is passed from the fqn, which is get from api.

Change-Id: I01c51d48185400f34a7dbd15fca349ad7ddbef05
Closes-Bug: #1493075

commit_message:
Magic Search CSS reuse

The App Catalog UI plugin is using Magic Search but is switching
away from using hz-magic-search-bar directly since it only
supports st-tables and the App Catalog UI supports a grid view
widget. This change allows the hz-magic-search css to be reused
by tagging elements with hz-magic-search-bar class instead of
the css expecting a hz-magic-search-bar element.

Closes-Bug: #1492422
Change-Id: I2ba937540f0bbfcead568ebdb3d8ff41c7a5db17

commit_message:
Fix HDS HNAS driver logging password as plain text

HDS HNAS driver logs every command that is sent to HNAS. Some
commands need the HNAS password, so the driver ends up logging
this password as plain text. This patch changes these commands
syntax so that oslo_utils.strutils.mask_password can successfully
mask this password.

Closes-Bug: #1491524
(cherry picked from commit 15755b8e9a5f8019e8d19b709b86d582d8b6e0c2)

Conflicts:
	cinder/volume/drivers/hds/hnas_backend.py

Change-Id: I5bc49f25b0d2a008a55dd2dbfe928a7c51590905

commit_message:
Increase connection_max_retries to be 300

We also set request_poll_timeout to be 3000 in neutron.conf;
This can help to resolve the error for could not ssh to instance for octavia gate-setting.


This patch is needed by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/209675/


Change-Id: I90002a8913dd7db375ff5740a3f9cd5566b82054

commit_message:
Disable python buffering for gate checks

In order to ensure that the ansible output in the jenkins console
log is output as it comes it is necessary to turn off the python
output buffering.

Change-Id: I0f8f11cd04fdfd6c26d5a5afc0e8647648edb1bb
(cherry picked from commit 614b37621bdd5c408d06ce57360dbbea61476e2f)

commit_message:
Add support of new extra spec 'snapshot_support'

On last midcycle meetup was decided to make snapshots optional feature.
So, add following features:

- Allow to setup 'snapshot_support' extra spec in share type creation
  request. Make it optional key with default 'True' value.
- Display this extra spec with 'type list' command as part of 'optional'
  extra specs.

Change-Id: Id8e11b591a713654f7237cb1b66aeeaebfbf5871
Implements blueprint snapshots-optional

commit_message:
Allow user to unset share network params

It is impossible to unset some value from share network if it was set.
Allow user to set share network params (name, description, neutron_net_id,
neutron_subnet_id) to empty value.

Closes-bug: #1446695

Change-Id: I43315d49a3b721db9619812656702c1865155338

commit_message:
Remove ebtables_driver/manager dead code

Previous changes[1] have been merged as enablers[2] to fix the bug
1274034 but an alternative solution has been choosen and now we can
consider the introduced code as dead code.

This changes removes [2], associated tests and rootwrap filters.

[1] I9ef57a86b1a1c1fa4ba1a034c920f23cb40072c0
    I3c66e92cbe8883dcad843ad243388def3a96dbe5
[2] neutron.agent.linux.ebtables_driver
    neutron.agent.linux.ebtables_manager

Closes-Bug: #1493422
Related-Bug: #1274034
Change-Id: I61e38fc0d8cf8e79252aabc19a70240be57e4a32

[{'number': 62, 'created': '2015-09-08 18:48:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/services/l3_router/test_l3_dvr_router_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Delete FIP agent gateway port with external gw port

FIP agent gateway ports are associated with external
networks and specific host.

Today FIP agent gateway ports are deleted for
every floatingip associate and disassociate. This
introduces race conditions in the port delete and also
un-necessary access to the db.

This patch will delete the FIP agent gateway port when
the last gateway port of the external network is deleted.

The child patch linked to this parent patch will clean
up the FIP agent gateway port delete when associate,
disassociate and delete of floatingip happens.

This should also cover the case when an agent for some
reason was unable to request agent gw port delete.
(agent died).

Related-Bug: #1408855
Related-Bug: #1468007
Related-Bug: #1450982

Change-Id: I6637a771e6a6ce74e848cb74b779043e16a54a84
'}]
commit_message:
Delete FIP agent gateway port with external gw port

FIP agent gateway ports are associated with external
networks and specific host.

Today FIP agent gateway ports are deleted for
every floatingip associate and disassociate. This
introduces race conditions in the port delete and also
un-necessary access to the db.

This patch will delete the FIP agent gateway port when
the last gateway port of the external network is deleted.

The child patch linked to this parent patch will clean
up the FIP agent gateway port delete when associate,
disassociate and delete of floatingip happens.

This should also cover the case when an agent for some
reason was unable to request agent gw port delete.
(agent died).

Related-Bug: #1408855
Related-Bug: #1468007
Related-Bug: #1450982

Change-Id: I6637a771e6a6ce74e848cb74b779043e16a54a84

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-21 03:01:01.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': 'Ensure images downloaded from a previous stack are fully downloaded

Currently, stack.sh does not check if an image file downloaded from
a previous stack.sh execution is fully downloaded before using it.
This patch updates the wget command to use the --timestamping
option which will re-download a file if the server modified date is
more recent than the local file as well as when the server file
size differs from the local file.

Change-Id: I343248f7d5e8bda19c93cb19092b5459b28244b0
Closes-Bug: #1403492
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure images downloaded from a previous stack are fully downloaded

Currently, stack.sh does not check if an image file downloaded from
a previous stack.sh execution is fully downloaded before using it.
This patch updates the wget command to use the --timestamping
option which will re-download a file if the server modified date is
more recent than the local file as well as when the server file
size differs from the local file.

Change-Id: I343248f7d5e8bda19c93cb19092b5459b28244b0
Closes-Bug: #1403492

commit_message:

The "new_size" parameter's description(The new
size, in gibibytes (GiB), of the volume.) is inapt which
should be "The new size of the volume, in gibibytes (GiB). "

Closes-Bug: #1493672

commit_message:
Add id to sort keys parameters while pagination

Currently default sort is a 'name'.
But in case there are more packages in catalog
with same name more then 'limit' parameter, all of them will be ignored.

Adding additional sort key is fixing that problem.

Change-Id: Idd86275dc48cbdb2862987f6e3151e1d9fb4e00f
Closes-Bug: #1448782

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-09-03 17:27:22.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/common/exceptions.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_sriov_nic_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/pci_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/sriov_nic_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/test_pci_lib.py'], 'message': "sriov: update port state even if ip link fails

Some SRIOV drivers/devices don't support link state setting,
meaning that 'ip link' fails like this when trying to set state:

 # ip l set dev p2p1 vf 6 state disable
 RTNETLINK answers: Operation not supported

The sriov-nic-agent tries to do that in
SriovNicSwitchAgent.treat_device() and fails because of non-zero
exit status from 'ip link' and, therefore, doesn't reach the code
that updates the actual port status, so port could hang in a BUILD
state even if binding was successful.

This patch fixes problem of nova not being able to successfully bind
or cleanup such a port. It does not fix a case when user manually
updates admin_state_up for a port via API, it's subject to a separate
fix.

Also, replace LOG.exception with LOG.warning for set_device_state()
as the exception would be logged by PciDeviceIPWrapper.set_vf_state()
anyway.

Closes-bug: #1468332
Change-Id: Ifa7c128d369ced60b5986aa0ed92527868f7efab
"}]
commit_message:
sriov: update port state even if ip link fails

Some SRIOV drivers/devices don't support link state setting,
meaning that 'ip link' fails like this when trying to set state:

 # ip l set dev p2p1 vf 6 state disable
 RTNETLINK answers: Operation not supported

The sriov-nic-agent tries to do that in
SriovNicSwitchAgent.treat_device() and fails because of non-zero
exit status from 'ip link' and, therefore, doesn't reach the code
that updates the actual port status, so port could hang in a BUILD
state even if binding was successful.

This patch fixes problem of nova not being able to successfully bind
or cleanup such a port. It does not fix a case when user manually
updates admin_state_up for a port via API, it's subject to a separate
fix.

Also, replace LOG.exception with LOG.warning for set_device_state()
as the exception would be logged by PciDeviceIPWrapper.set_vf_state()
anyway.

Closes-bug: #1468332
Change-Id: Ifa7c128d369ced60b5986aa0ed92527868f7efab

subject: Added the support of Glance Artifact Repository
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-09 13:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/local/local_settings.py.example', 'muranodashboard/packages/tables.py', 'muranodashboard/api/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Added the support of Glance Artifact Repository

Murano's application packages can now be stored either in database
(using murano-api) or in Glance Artifact repository (so-called Glance
V3 api). This patch adds an experimental support of the latter
approach to murano dashboard.

As all the difference between these two storages is incapsulated in
the murano client, dashboard just needs to configure it properly by
passing an instance of glance v3 client on creation. This is
controlled by the presence of MURANO_USE_GLARE setting in
local_settings.py. If it exists and is True, muranoclient will store
the packages in Glance. The old mode will be used otherwise.

This patch also adds a "Version" column to the "Package Definitions"
view to display the version of each package. The values are set only
if Artifacts-based storage s in use; the column is populated by dashes
otherwise.

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository-support

Change-Id: I7f77650436ce4c4845ccbbbabf58872a41d3c14c
'}]
commit_message:
Added the support of Glance Artifact Repository

Murano's application packages can now be stored either in database
(using murano-api) or in Glance Artifact repository (so-called Glance
V3 api). This patch adds an experimental support of the latter
approach to murano dashboard.

As all the difference between these two storages is incapsulated in
the murano client, dashboard just needs to configure it properly by
passing an instance of glance v3 client on creation. This is
controlled by the presence of MURANO_USE_GLARE setting in
local_settings.py. If it exists and is True, muranoclient will store
the packages in Glance. The old mode will be used otherwise.

This patch also adds a "Version" column to the "Package Definitions"
view to display the version of each package. The values are set only
if Artifacts-based storage s in use; the column is populated by dashes
otherwise.

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository-support
Depends-on: I35d71bb7c03b23b01722e060c3ef770a24168ada
Change-Id: I7f77650436ce4c4845ccbbbabf58872a41d3c14c

subject: Fixed incorrect MuranoPL names for some of Python-based methods
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 14:20:54.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/murano_package.py'], 'message': "Fixed incorrect MuranoPL names for some of Python-based methods

When method that was defined in Python get registered in MuranoPL
it name changes according to yaql conventions (and thus report_error
becomes reportError). However this translation was buggy because
1. It didn't respect dsl.name('name') decorator that was supposed to
override default behavior
2. It didn't strip underscores from the right of the name as yaql usually
does (that prevent from name collisions in Python)

Because of those issues applications that relied on StatusReporter::report_error
method became broken.

This commit fixes both of the issues with name translation.

Change-Id: I84d4bd4df1af5bbe150f89c096afd8c52ad3da1a
Closes-Bug: #1493875
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed incorrect MuranoPL names for some of Python-based methods

When method that was defined in Python get registered in MuranoPL
it name changes according to yaql conventions (and thus report_error
becomes reportError). However this translation was buggy because
1. It didn't respect dsl.name('name') decorator that was supposed to
override default behavior
2. It didn't strip underscores from the right of the name as yaql usually
does (that prevent from name collisions in Python)

Because of those issues applications that relied on StatusReporter::report_error
method became broken.

This commit fixes both of the issues with name translation.

Change-Id: I84d4bd4df1af5bbe150f89c096afd8c52ad3da1a
Closes-Bug: #1493875

commit_message:
Allow indexing of single type or index

Adds --type and --index optional arguments to manage.py index sync
(accepting zero or more values in both cases).

index sync will clear all data after prompting; --force disables
the prompt.

Change-Id: I466a63083ed9cad434c4b1c2f35eff68a6081856
Closes-Bug: #1482897

subject: Adds decorator to create properties
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-08 20:17:37.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/language/specs.py', 'yaql/__init__.py', 'yaql/standard_library/system.py', 'yaql/language/yaqltypes.py', 'yaql/tests/test_system.py'], 'message': "Adds decorator to create properties

With properties it is possible to have expressions like
$expr.foo handled by a function that trades $expr for 'foo'
property value.

This is done by 2 pieces:
1) #operator_. that handles $xpr.keyword expressions
that could not be handled by other registered operator
overloads and convert it to #property#keyword($expr)
dynamically constructed function name

2) Decorator that transforms func(source) into a
registered in context

Because property name is part of a called function name
there is no need to have separate #operator_. implementation
for all possible combinations of (type, property_name) and
makes property name be used in a context lookup thus
speeding it up

Change-Id: I8c39715d425d991cb2c1726e83c415f401cfd8fe
"}]
commit_message:
Adds decorator to create properties

With properties it is possible to have expressions like
$expr.foo handled by a function that trades $expr for 'foo'
property value.

This is done by 2 pieces:
1) #operator_. that handles $xpr.keyword expressions
that could not be handled by other registered operator
overloads and convert it to #property#keyword($expr)
dynamically constructed function name

2) Decorator that transforms func(source) into a
registered in context

Because property name is part of a called function name
there is no need to have separate #operator_. implementation
for all possible combinations of (type, property_name) and
makes property name be used in a context lookup thus
speeding it up

Change-Id: I8c39715d425d991cb2c1726e83c415f401cfd8fe

commit_message:
Refactoring of conventions code

* Simplifies convention classes, moves all special names
processing code into specs.
 * Now it is possible to have special functions with suffixes
 that conventions will apply to. For example
 #prefix_name_do_something will remain intact but
 #prefix_name#do_something will be converted to
 #prefix_name#doSomething. This will be later used to implement
properties

Change-Id: I3b0c7bc71cbf97015a70f447b192d69c5e53f14b

commit_message:
Update response codes to expected ones

When session id or body were not provided - forbidden code was raised.
That may lead to confusion and make debuggind difficult.

This commit fixes error codes and provides explanation is responses.

API specification is updated.

Closes-Bug #1491785

Change-Id: I87d60a1a7d049ee7d482dd76ceeb9f446b452fca

commit_message:
Supporting run command

If the run_cmd is specified on the command line using a flag,
then that is used. Otherwise, the one specified in the app file
is used. User is asked to input the command if it is neither
specified in the app file nor it is specified using command line flag.

Closes-Bug: #1491624

Change-Id: I7692b7d248c77e2af2b9a19b856e2cb5f0709acb

commit_message:
Added validation checks and app-file flag to app create

- Added support for --app-file command line flag. This is keeping in with
  the --plan-file command line flag that is currently supported for
  app create

- Added validation checks for ensuring that:
  - name conforms to certain length and character class requirements
  - workflow_config, if specified in app-file, is not empty
  - trigger_actions, if specified in app-file, is not empty

Closes-Bug: #1491629
Closes-Bug: #1491630

Change-Id: Id4b15b25db5824659dd6e3920eab770977b407ad

subject: Adds new app and workflow commands
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-02 23:45:09.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/common/base.py', 'solumclient/tests/test_solum.py', 'solumclient/v1/client.py', 'solumclient/v1/workflow.py', 'solumclient/solum.py', 'solumclient/v1/app.py', 'solumclient/common/cli_utils.py'], 'message': "Adds new app and workflow commands

Old app commands renamed to oldapp

Currently Solum CLI uses 'plan' and 'assembly' resources in the API.
Specifically,

'solum app create' in CLI makes a POST call to '/v1/plans' and
'solum app deploy' in CLI makes a
POST call to '/v1/plans/<plan-id>/assemblies'

Recently we have introduced 'app' and 'workflow' resources in
Solum API. We want to modify the Solum CLI to start using
these resources. Specifically,

'solum app create' in CLI should make a POST call to '/v1/apps' and
'solum app deploy' in CLI should make a
POST call to '/v1/apps/<app-id>/workflows'

Thus, we want to port all the current functionality of
Solum 'app commands' to use 'app' and 'workflow' resources.

One way to do this porting is as follows:

- Rename the current 'app' commands to something else (say, 'oldapp')
- Introduce a new 'app' command manager where the required
functionality is built out
- Port over the functionality from 'oldapp' to the 'app'
- Delete the 'oldapp' command and related code once all the
functionality has been ported over.

Partial-Bug: #1491632

Change-Id: I1404775c458e925ac117ae71b90c10957e21a02a
"}]
commit_message:
Adds new app and workflow commands

Old app commands renamed to oldapp

Currently Solum CLI uses 'plan' and 'assembly' resources in the API.
Specifically,

'solum app create' in CLI makes a POST call to '/v1/plans' and
'solum app deploy' in CLI makes a
POST call to '/v1/plans/<plan-id>/assemblies'

Recently we have introduced 'app' and 'workflow' resources in
Solum API. We want to modify the Solum CLI to start using
these resources. Specifically,

'solum app create' in CLI should make a POST call to '/v1/apps' and
'solum app deploy' in CLI should make a
POST call to '/v1/apps/<app-id>/workflows'

Thus, we want to port all the current functionality of
Solum 'app commands' to use 'app' and 'workflow' resources.

One way to do this porting is as follows:

- Rename the current 'app' commands to something else (say, 'oldapp')
- Introduce a new 'app' command manager where the required
functionality is built out
- Port over the functionality from 'oldapp' to the 'app'
- Delete the 'oldapp' command and related code once all the
functionality has been ported over.

Partial-Bug: #1491632

Change-Id: I1404775c458e925ac117ae71b90c10957e21a02a

commit_message:
Angular docs - code theory and translation

Updates to the angularjs.rst documentation which describe how
Angular code is organized within Horizon framework and the
Dashboard application.

Also updates the documentation for translation to follow the current
patterns.

This completes the dashboard re-organization work planned for https://launchpad.net/bugs/1478717.

View formatted output by:
1. cd /horizon/doc/
2. make html
3. open file:///<path to horizon>/doc/build/html/topics/angularjs.html

Change-Id: Icf892223af01211ad4f764708f925d0a94035f51
Co-Authored-By: Tyr Johanson <tyr@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rob Cresswell <rcresswe@cisco.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-docs
Closes-Bug: 1478717

commit_message:
Add links for release notes tool

The automated release note tool expects to find links to the bug
tracker, documentation, and source using a specific regex. This change
adds the links using the expected format so they are found and included
in the release announcements.

Change-Id: I5fa24f60c7d705593996194b865ffb2c47870808

commit_message:
Add version info for pyghmi in driver-requirements.txt

It was found earlier today that some earlier versions of pyghmi don't
work with Ironic due to missing commands etc. I didn't investigate
exactly which versions work, however 0.8.0 is known to be working. So
pin pyghmi to >=0.8.0.

Change-Id: Iabd52167220f686f86c07abe12520e20780d0179

commit_message:
Revisit required provision states

* Recommend using ENROLL for setting IPMI credentials
* Deprecate using maintenance mode, will be dropped once we stop
  supporting Ironic Kilo
* Drop bits related to Ironic Juno, we no longer support it
* Clarify error message about wrong provision state, stop mentioning
  maintenance mode there

Change-Id: I3a9d3ba24a32c7844cd6fd5e4f8ec4b15b2d9d20
Closes-Bug: #1479331

commit_message:
Skip upgrade_fuel_after_rollback for CentOS

- Skip upgrade_fuel_after_rollback test for CentOS
because we can't deploy new cluster after upgrade
and this test is running with rollback tests and
fail all the time

Related-Bug: #1493344

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-03 20:23:50.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.
This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: Ib302d7386e0b55d869e528b95fb7bb6b27db3b97
'}]
commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.
This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: Ib302d7386e0b55d869e528b95fb7bb6b27db3b97

commit_message:
Add 'sort' parameter

Somehow we left sorting out! Adds support for 'sort', which can either
be:
  * a string scalar
  * a dict (name: order)
  * a list of the above

The 'sort' parameter is added to the Elasticsearch query.

Change-Id: I14bd6ab4a65569becc998aa257a06532fc363ef4
Closes-Bug: #1478177

This removes the rootwrap filters that are now provided by the os-brick
library. This decouples os-brick from having to update nova with new
rootwrap filters before it can land new code for nova to use.

Change-Id: I37119ede76fff52cd3ddd30cc8fc37fab0e0c1ef

commit_message:
Let os-brick provide rootwrap filters

This removes the rootwrap filters that are now provided by the os-brick
library. This decouples os-brick from having to update nova with new
rootwrap filters before it can land new code for nova to use.

This change has two dependencies, one for the requirements sync to
require os-brick>=0.4.0 and the other is the devstack change which puts
the os-brick rootwrap filter in place for nova to use.

Depends-On: Iedae83b1c4d6e53fc1f80fe30ed47766f83e64d5
Depends-On: I9d77783c4cc8d8db7fff21543526fd4060f8b12b

UpgradeImpact: The release notes need to be updated to point out that
    etc/os-brick/rootwrap.d/*.filters from the os-brick library need to
    be copied into /etc/nova/rootwrap.d/ before starting the
    nova-compute service and performing volume operations.

Closes-Bug: #1479842

Change-Id: I37119ede76fff52cd3ddd30cc8fc37fab0e0c1ef

commit_message:
Use barbican.conf instead of barbican-api.conf

Since barbican-api.conf was deprecated in favor of barbican.conf
this change needs to also be reflected in the code that actually loads
the configuration in the server. This change properly reflects that.

Change-Id: I243fe7d98fda9bd4ceeb8850c7747f9bd8250b00

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-09 11:38:11.000000000', 'files': ['etc/rootwrap/os-brick.filters', 'etc/README.txt', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "Move the rootwrap filters

This patch moves the rootwrap filters from a structure
that might confuse some folks.   The original structure looks
like the filters might get automatically installed into /etc/os-brick,
which they won't.

This patch also adds a README.txt to explain how to install the filters.

Also, don't install an /etc tree for os-brick. It's not usable by
rootwrap, so is just confusing to users of the system that assumes
that it is.

Change-Id: I1d86d16919f32ab140034a17eca02285a1a2a2be
Related-Bug: 1479842
"}]
commit_message:
Move the rootwrap filters

This patch moves the rootwrap filters from a structure
that might confuse some folks.   The original structure looks
like the filters might get automatically installed into /etc/os-brick,
which they won't.

This patch also adds a README.txt to explain how to install the filters.

Also, don't install an /etc tree for os-brick. It's not usable by
rootwrap, so is just confusing to users of the system that assumes
that it is.

Change-Id: I1d86d16919f32ab140034a17eca02285a1a2a2be
Related-Bug: 1479842

commit_message:
Copy rootwrap filters

This patch copies os-brick's list of rootwrap filters for commands
that are needed to execute from /usr/local/etc/os-brick/rootwrap.d
to service's rootwrap.d directory to enable filters.

This patch has the following dependencies which are all merged now:

The os-brick patch I2b1e657b87c7b27548200a20b991f34c3413c24b adds
os-brick's list of rootwrap filters for commands that are needed
to execute. That patch is merged and it is in os-brick 0.4.0
which is already released.

This devstack patch also needs the minimum required version of
os-brick in global-requirements to be bumped to 0.4.0. That change
I2f5ca36da2e5d84be260e32da269802993d7722f is merged as well.

Partial-Bug: #1479842

Change-Id: I9d77783c4cc8d8db7fff21543526fd4060f8b12b

commit_message:
Fix of haproxy ssl misconfiguration with nova_console

If you are using haproxy_ssl: True, you don't
have the ssl directive in haproxy/conf.d/nova_console
for the bind section.

This fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1493429
Change-Id: Idbde44b191082a65ae2f716acd030ef84c237238

commit_message:
Correct wrong cancel action url in Extra Specs page

In the Volume Type Extra Specs page, in create and edit Volume Type
Extra Spec modal dialog the cancel action redirect to wrong url,
when right click the cancel button, it will cast error. In the
QoS Spec page, there has the same error. This patch fix them.

Change-Id: If705635b2f89e78eeec34d8f99d7317e2c88ce59
Closes-Bug: #1490375

subject: stackforge/networking-bagpipe-l2: add python-jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-09 15:11:14.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "stackforge/networking-bagpipe-l2: add python-jobs

Adds python-jobs for stackforge/networking-bagpipe-l2 project.

The testsuite is currently empty but the tox.ini is clean and
both 'tox -epy17' and 'tox -epy34' run fine.

Note that not having any python-jobs block any merge from hapenning
on the project because the only job is the check-requirement job which
is a conditional job (as was explained to me by fungi).

Hence it would be great to merge this change as quickly as possible.

Change-Id: I3eefd7deefc2319cdc9b6c922394dadae4ae4f52
"}]
commit_message:
stackforge/networking-bagpipe-l2: add python-jobs

Adds python-jobs for stackforge/networking-bagpipe-l2 project.

The testsuite is currently empty but the tox.ini is clean and
both 'tox -epy17' and 'tox -epy34' run fine.

Note that not having any python-jobs block any merge from hapenning
on the project because the only job is the check-requirement job which
is a conditional job (as was explained to me by fungi).

Hence it would be great to merge this change as quickly as possible.

Change-Id: I3eefd7deefc2319cdc9b6c922394dadae4ae4f52

Fix install guide link in Pre-Upgrade Testing Environment

In OpenStack Operations Guide, now the "installation guide"
below is pointing to "http://docs.openstack.org/". We'd
better have it point to
"http://docs.openstack.org/index.html#install-guides".

"Do a full manual install by using the OpenStack Installation Guide for
your platform. Review the final configuration files and installed
packages.""

Closes-bug: #1493837

commit_message:
Fix wrong murano-dashboard url

Currently Murano URL uses the same address that has keystone, but
it's wrong in the case when keystone will be detached.

So we should use address, which is used for host binding.

Change-Id: I767e1d15c115421ec0f2d0777674608cc31c7f68
Closes-bug: #1493795

commit_message:
restrict admin event access

this patch restricts the scope of returned events. if admin role,
user is allowed to query all events which have traits.project_id
value that match it's own project OR any event without any
project_id trait.

Implements: blueprint events-rbac
Change-Id: I41d30b2fc11c226e109c499e7a35fdb2fa057e0b

subject: Allow Test VM RAM setting to be tunable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 21:20:58.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/README.md', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/defaults/main.yml', 'scripts/test-bifrost-build-images.sh'], 'message': 'Allow Test VM RAM setting to be tunable

Due to the debian + simple-init image size, which is not a small
image, we need to support having slightly larger guest VMs in order
to allow for the image to be downloaded to the guest VM.

Add tunable setting, and default the image build test job to create
a VM with 4096 MB of RAM instead of 3072 MB.

Change-Id: Ifdccb32035fa91fe8d8200c3090973c34d453801
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Test VM RAM setting to be tunable

Due to the debian + simple-init image size, which is not a small
image, we need to support having slightly larger guest VMs in order
to allow for the image to be downloaded to the guest VM.

Add tunable setting, and default the image build test job to create
a VM with 4096 MB of RAM instead of 3072 MB.

commit_message:
Made router detail status and admin state translatable

The "Status" and "Admin State" labels on the Router Details panel in both the
Project and Admin dashboards are currently untranslatable.  This patch
fixes that issue and allows these labels to be translated.

Change-Id: I5f78701d4b830bab115a7e8da39714f00da90273
Partial-Bug: #1441366

commit_message:
Image-create backwards compatibility

As is-public and is-protected would now map onto the new command meaning
when people upgrade it will not break lots of peoples stuff, allowing
for backwards-compatablitiy.

The commands now map onto the new style of commands, taking the old
style and updating the new values.

Change-Id: I97828ffb7654a08d1fd90831d62ddb5219773a99

subject: Remove POSIX users, groups, and file modes.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-04 13:34:47.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Remove POSIX users, groups, and file modes.

This patch removes File resources which should be delivered by packaging
tools.  These resources (files, directories, modes, users, and group
attributes) could be in conflict with different OS packaging systems
which isn't a desired result.

Change-Id: Ia7a8a71ef897d989f10ab511e6aa0432693041a5
Closes-Bug: #1458915
"}]
commit_message:
Remove POSIX users, groups, and file modes.

This patch removes File resources which should be delivered by packaging
tools.  These resources (files, directories, modes, users, and group
attributes) could be in conflict with different OS packaging systems
which isn't a desired result.

Change-Id: Ia7a8a71ef897d989f10ab511e6aa0432693041a5
Closes-Bug: #1458915

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 10:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/admin/test_shares_actions.py'], 'message': "Fix concurrency issue in tempest test

Tempest test 'test_list_shares_with_detail_filter_by_extra_specs' fails
with following error from time to time:

ValueError: Share 'cdd499f7-6b02-4f47-8b39-7093b4d07e11' listed with
extra_specs filter has nonexistent share type 'share-type-1283899337'.

It happens because list of share types is taken for each step of a loop
Get list of share types only once and before taking list of shares, in
that case we will have share objects with still existing share types.

Change-Id: I0c29d16385255599b902757544e31ebbec79ca84
Closes-Bug: #1493125
"}]
commit_message:
Fix concurrency issue in tempest test

Tempest test 'test_list_shares_with_detail_filter_by_extra_specs' fails
with following error from time to time:

ValueError: Share 'cdd499f7-6b02-4f47-8b39-7093b4d07e11' listed with
extra_specs filter has nonexistent share type 'share-type-1283899337'.

It happens because list of share types is taken for each step of a loop
Get list of share types only once and before taking list of shares, in
that case we will have share objects with still existing share types.

Change-Id: I0c29d16385255599b902757544e31ebbec79ca84
Closes-Bug: #1493125

If the unexpected exception is raised from datasource

start to run, but the command line yields an error.

Closes-Bug: #1491209

commit_message:
Fix datasource creation inconsistency

If the unexpected exception is raised from datasource
driver __init__(), it might cause the driver's poll_loop()
start to run, but the command line yields an error.

Fix the inconsistency, start the poll_loop() after datasource
driver init success.

Change-Id: I5398b5dfdad257927bea1fb8dbf10fce8600662f
Closes-Bug: #1492329
Closes-Bug: #1491209

commit_message:
Environment modify actions introduced

Base class for modify actions.
Entry points based action registration.
Action manager loads and execute actions.
Out-of-the-box actions implementation.

Partially implements: blueprint policy-based-env-modification

Change-Id: Ib148c5f2b7efb1186d77f5461ef9324cca1287c2

'lib/puppet/type/neutron_plugin_cisco.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/neutron_plugin_linuxbridge.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_config/ini_setting.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/neutron_plugin_plumgrid.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron_l3_agent_config/ini_setting.rb', 'spec/acceptance/neutron_config_spec.rb'], 'message': "Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in neutron_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

The same logic applies for all the neutron resources that edit a
ini-like configuration file.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I3f972ecbde3719fe71a82a64f894d41f6ea7e842
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218
"}]
commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in neutron_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

The same logic applies for all the neutron resources that edit a
ini-like configuration file.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

neutron_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I3f972ecbde3719fe71a82a64f894d41f6ea7e842
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218

subject: Autorequire correct package based on the distro
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-09 10:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/glance_registry_paste_ini.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_api_paste_ini.rb', 'spec/unit/type/glance_api_config_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_cache_config.rb', 'spec/unit/type/glance_cache_config_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_registry_config.rb', 'spec/unit/type/glance_registry_config_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_api_config.rb'], 'message': "Autorequire correct package based on the distro

Some distros (RHEL based) have a single glance package. On those
distros the ensure_package/autorequire stuff doesn't quite work
correctly as per the type code it is assumed two packages 'glance-api'
and 'glance-registry'

This commit makes sure that on RHEL based distros type only autorequire
'openstack-glance' while on other distros it correctly autorequire
'glance-api' and 'glance-registry'

Change-Id: I17c84b2282beadaec80f4db42fa5696b7967159f
Closes-bug: #1493442
Co-Authored-By: Yanis Guenane <yguenane@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Autorequire correct package based on the distro

Some distros (RHEL based) have a single glance package. On those
distros the ensure_package/autorequire stuff doesn't quite work
correctly as per the type code it is assumed two packages 'glance-api'
and 'glance-registry'

This commit makes sure that on RHEL based distros type only autorequire
'openstack-glance' while on other distros it correctly autorequire
'glance-api' and 'glance-registry'

Change-Id: I17c84b2282beadaec80f4db42fa5696b7967159f
Closes-bug: #1493442
Co-Authored-By: Yanis Guenane <yguenane@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add distribute mode for Sahara

Sahara can be configured to run in a distributed mode that creates
a separation between the API and Engine processes. This allows the
API process to remain relatively free to handle requests while
offloading intensive tasks to the engine processes. [1]

Also keep possibility to run old all-in-one mode.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/sahara/userdoc/advanced.configuration.guide.html#distributed-mode-configuration

Change-Id: Id3aa75229e8626c71d6cb8398af3c2c22f37b592

This patch fixes a regression caused by commit during synchronising upstream
Kilo puppet manifests to 7.0: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/189678/
(parameter database_max_pool_size was set to 10) but even in 5.0 we set
this parameter to 50 by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100859
And this is correct and confirmed again at the scale lab

Change-Id: Ieef197baa2a6aff26aa8894b3dea2254a1272a2d
'}]
commit_message:
Change DB max pool size to 50 for neutron-server

This patch fixes a regression caused by commit during synchronising upstream
Kilo puppet manifests to 7.0: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/189678/
(parameter database_max_pool_size was set to 10) but even in 5.0 we set
this parameter to 50 by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100859
And this is correct and confirmed again at the scale lab

Closes-Bug: #1493732
Change-Id: Ieef197baa2a6aff26aa8894b3dea2254a1272a2d
