commit_message:
Added CORS middleware to Sahara

This adds the CORS support middleware to Sahara, allowing a deployer
to optionally configure rules under which a javascript client may
break the single-origin policy and access the API directly.

OpenStack Spec:
   http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/cors-support.html
Oslo_Middleware Docs:
   http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.middleware/cors.html
OpenStack Cloud Admin Guide:
   http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/cross_project_cors.html

Change-Id: I839e2adc0a13271cfb590a52a6626660cc17190e

commit_message:
Set DocFolder correctly for Zanata

Since Zanata has trouble mapping .pot files that don't start with ./
for projects that set trans-dir and src-dir to ., make use of a new
variable to set them correctly for all manuals projects.

Change-Id: I729633db3e76cc07e0ec3d5083c15fa73770a21c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-07 10:59:32.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': 'Download image from dl.fedoraproject.org

Download the Fedora cloud image directly from a specific server. The
link on fedoraproject.org can redirect us to any of a number of servers
which may be bad. Also using the same server each time will make caching
easier on our proxy.

Change-Id: Id71ba02a14bb3c5f25002f7780fde6e4b1aa8bcf
'}]
commit_message:
Download image from dl.fedoraproject.org

Download the Fedora cloud image directly from a specific server. The
link on fedoraproject.org can redirect us to any of a number of servers
which may be bad. Also using the same server each time will make caching
easier on our proxy.

Change-Id: Id71ba02a14bb3c5f25002f7780fde6e4b1aa8bcf

subject: Add an authentication layer for Redis
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-09 13:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'controller.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Add an authentication layer for Redis

Currently Redis instances are wide open if anyone knows the Redis IPs.
This commit ensures that client authenticate correctly before doing any
operation on Redis instances.

Enabling authentication has two impact :

  * Our Redis instances needs to setup the requirepass option on their
    configuration file

  * The coordination URL in ceilometer needs to provide the proper
    password in order to operate properly

Sources :

 * http://redis.io/topics/security [Authentication Feature]

Change-Id: I57628afde67d2b154c5d41b8b880681644d58682
'}]
commit_message:
Add an authentication layer for Redis

Currently Redis instances are wide open if anyone knows the Redis IPs.
This commit ensures that client authenticate correctly before doing any
operation on Redis instances.

Enabling authentication has two impact :

  * Our Redis instances needs to setup the requirepass option on their
    configuration file

  * The coordination URL in ceilometer needs to provide the proper
    password in order to operate properly

Sources :

 * http://redis.io/topics/security [Authentication Feature]

Change-Id: I57628afde67d2b154c5d41b8b880681644d58682

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 16:03:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Add some explanation for the instance AZ field

Since it's pretty confusing to understand why an instance AZ can be different
from the host AZ the instance belongs to, and since that field is never
updated even after an instance is scheduled to an host, we think it's good
to add a comment in the DB model to explain that.

Change-Id: Id0914530cbacf4cf5c3319f1401bf07b3112935d
"}]
commit_message:
Add some explanation for the instance AZ field

Since it's pretty confusing to understand why an instance AZ can be different
from the host AZ the instance belongs to, and since that field is never
updated even after an instance is scheduled to an host, we think it's good
to add a comment in the DB model to explain that.

Change-Id: Id0914530cbacf4cf5c3319f1401bf07b3112935d

commit_message:
Use b64encode to replace of encodestring

The encodestring() method is used to encode a string, and return a string
containing one or more lines of base64-encoded data. For meter_id, the
return is same as b64encode() method except an extra trailing newline
('\n').

Change-Id: Ia14747ff0b4c643b33ed99da7fa422480f0f8095
Closes-Bug: #1271530

subject: Don't make `help` require auth parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-09 10:47:13.000000000', 'files': ['glanceclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'glanceclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Don't make `help` require auth parameters

The `help` command was behaving a bit funky. This patch re-orders the
code a bit so that the `help` command will be parsed at the very
beginning before running other commands and checks.

It also allows to get help without downloading/checking schemas and
without requiring auth credentials (previously required by the schema
operations).

Change-Id: Ib7b10d4d80f15e6b75bb8644d7d916bef09413d6
Closes-bug: #1490457
"}]
commit_message:
Don't make `help` require auth parameters

The `help` command was behaving a bit funky. This patch re-orders the
code a bit so that the `help` command will be parsed at the very
beginning before running other commands and checks.

It also allows to get help without downloading/checking schemas and
without requiring auth credentials (previously required by the schema
operations).

Change-Id: Ib7b10d4d80f15e6b75bb8644d7d916bef09413d6
Closes-bug: #1490457

commit_message:
Compute v2.1 docs clean up (part 3) (baremetal-nodes)

Add baremetal-nodes based on v2-ext
  with changes API path from v2.0 to v2.1
  and  adding
   delete /v2.1/{tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-baremetal-nodes/{node_id}

Change-Id: I72412b3df321c3b82451e50a9f26955c5b64517a
Partial-Bug: #1488144

commit_message:
Add user_id to keypair index/show/create/delete api

Add user_id for query and
    user_id for json in create case.
Also type is changed from required to optional in create case
    see following line around 63 to 67
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70485/23/nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/keypairs.py,unified

Change-Id: I3d67ba2f39ee5774795267c460269513d819ea3b
Closes-Bug: #1481577

subject: Fixes unit tests on Windows
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-08 06:05:45.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes unit tests on Windows

wmi module may exist in Windows and it is imported before it is mocked,

Change-Id: I409859a161a3f4145470ff37aa679433aadb577f
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes unit tests on Windows

wmi module may exist in Windows and it is imported before it is mocked,
which means that the imported library is used instead.

Change-Id: I409859a161a3f4145470ff37aa679433aadb577f

The SQLAlchemy MySQL dialect generates implicit indexes
in the less-common case of an integer column within a composite
primary key where autoincrement is not set to False.
Add a rule to ignore these indexes when performing

commit_message:
Add non-model index names to autogen exclude filters

The SQLAlchemy MySQL dialect generates implicit indexes
in the less-common case of an integer column within a composite
primary key where autoincrement is not set to False.
Add a rule to ignore these indexes when performing
autogenerate against a target database.

Change-Id: I49abb3f7ad9731cde046fa2862cdb9ec16c3aeb3
Partially-Implements: blueprint online-schema-migrations

commit_message:
Implement expand/contract autogenerate extension

Makes use of new Alembic 0.8 features to allow
altering of the "alembic revision" stream such
that operations for expand and contract are
directed into separate branches.

Change-Id: Ifa743e2f5b90e59a8de8f4e7a67c4bbe46686804
Partially-Implements: blueprint online-schema-migrations

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 22:04:37.000000000', 'files': ['toci_functions.sh'], 'message': 'Export DIB_REPOREF var in cherrypick function

Updates the cherrypick function to also export a corresponding
$DIB_REPOREF variable for the associated cherrypick. This causes
cherrypicks for puppet modules to be written to the generated
/tmp/puppet.env file so that they take effect for the undercloud install
and overcloud image builds.

Change-Id: Iea956918a4a43ed47e053fd2fe165d80eefda677
'}]
commit_message:
Export DIB_REPOREF var in cherrypick function

Updates the cherrypick function to also export a corresponding
$DIB_REPOREF variable for the associated cherrypick. This causes
cherrypicks for puppet modules to be written to the generated
/tmp/puppet.env file so that they take effect for the undercloud install
and overcloud image builds.

Change-Id: Iea956918a4a43ed47e053fd2fe165d80eefda677

subject: Remove SoftwareDeployment nova.server custom constraint
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6577, 'name': 'Sergey Kraynev', 'email': 'sergejyit@gmail.com', 'username': 'skraynev'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7385, 'name': 'Thomas Herve', 'email': 'therve@redhat.com', 'username': 'therve'}, {'_account_id': 10487, 'name': 'Kanagaraj Manickam', 'email': 'mkr1481@gmail.com', 'username': 'kanagarajm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-09 09:10:56.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/software_deployment.py'], 'message': 'Remove SoftwareDeployment nova.server custom constraint

Currently we strictly enforce that SoftwareDeployment resources only
ever be used with actual nova server resource ID's, but while this is
the common/expected use-case, it's technically not *required* that you
use a nova server ID, any resource which can have metadata updates is
valid, and enabling such flexibility allows for various additional
usage which are currently not possible:

 - Easier testing by using a dummy server resource, such as a nested
   stack overriding OS::Nova::Server, where you can inspect the
   metadata is as expected after a series of NO_SIGNAL deployments.
 - Configuration of pre-provisioned hosts not known to Nova, e.g either
   deployed via Ironic directly or not deployed by OpenStack at all.
 - SoftwareConfiguration of server-like resources implemented via custom
   resource plugins.

Until we work out a way to enable per-stack/per-resource override of
specific "hidden" custom constraints (e.g those in the properties
schema), it seems reasonable to relax this particular one to enable
the above usage (e.g TripleO are interested in the pre-provisioned
host use-case to use Heat for container orchestration on the local
host for all-in-one PoC deployments).

Change-Id: I7413b49e354d60742fde458acc666e9ab2bb8092
'}]
commit_message:
Remove SoftwareDeployment nova.server custom constraint

Currently we strictly enforce that SoftwareDeployment resources only
ever be used with actual nova server resource ID's, but while this is
the common/expected use-case, it's technically not *required* that you
use a nova server ID, any resource which can have metadata updates is
valid, and enabling such flexibility allows for various additional
usage which are currently not possible:

 - Easier testing by using a dummy server resource, such as a nested
   stack overriding OS::Nova::Server, where you can inspect the
   metadata is as expected after a series of NO_SIGNAL deployments.
 - Configuration of pre-provisioned hosts not known to Nova, e.g either
   deployed via Ironic directly or not deployed by OpenStack at all.
 - SoftwareConfiguration of server-like resources implemented via custom
   resource plugins.

Until we work out a way to enable per-stack/per-resource override of
specific "hidden" custom constraints (e.g those in the properties
schema), it seems reasonable to relax this particular one to enable
the above usage (e.g TripleO are interested in the pre-provisioned
host use-case to use Heat for container orchestration on the local
host for all-in-one PoC deployments).

Change-Id: I7413b49e354d60742fde458acc666e9ab2bb8092

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-09 08:58:59.000000000', 'files': ['lib/ceilometer'], 'message': 'Update lib/ceilometer to reflect script renames

Without this change some services for ceilometer will not start
breaking CI.

This change I7447ba4f408c95b0acf1b809504ce16fff1c6e21 was validated
against the ceilometer devstack plugin but apparently not against
devstack itself. Until I413ab159474b7d7231ad66d3a482201f74efe8a8

Change-Id: Ib1ea8b6ef7019570f82b0ba87e03fc627c8f6801

commit_message:
Update lib/ceilometer to reflect script renames

Without this change some services for ceilometer will not start
breaking CI.

This change I7447ba4f408c95b0acf1b809504ce16fff1c6e21 was validated
against the ceilometer devstack plugin but apparently not against
devstack itself. Until I413ab159474b7d7231ad66d3a482201f74efe8a8
merges devstack still has ceilometer support and is used in the
gate.

Change-Id: Ib1ea8b6ef7019570f82b0ba87e03fc627c8f6801

commit_message:
Convert api internal TypeError to HTTPBadRequest

Previously, when created environment without environment name provided, it
return meaningless HTTP 500 with internal TypeError exception traceback. So
add ResourceExceptionHandler to convert these exceptions generated by API
implementation methods to webob exception.

Change-Id: I221a6e0d36afb04b4d0c12f6a9c0d1f1da6f9bdb
Closes-Bug: #1491788

subject: Retry on initial contact with swift
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 17:56:18.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/swift.py'], 'message': 'Retry on initial contact with swift

If gnocchi and keystone start up at the same time the swift backend
may experience authentication errors while keystone is coming up. To
be more resilient in the face of this, the intial put_container call
used at swift+carbonara startup will retry for a minute if it
receives an authorization error.

Due to clumsy exception handling in swiftclient, the retry logic is
less robust than it should be.

Change-Id: I1557588bdb1d65d7c845356f2f63dc71a0aad279
Partial-Bug: #1493060
'}]
commit_message:
Retry on initial contact with swift

If gnocchi and keystone start up at the same time the swift backend
may experience authentication errors while keystone is coming up. To
be more resilient in the face of this, the intial put_container call
used at swift+carbonara startup will retry for a minute if it
receives an authorization error.

Due to clumsy exception handling in swiftclient, the retry logic is
less robust than it should be.

Change-Id: I1557588bdb1d65d7c845356f2f63dc71a0aad279
Partial-Bug: #1493060

subject: When no version given, default to v2.0
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}, {'_account_id': 15888, 'name': 'Zhenyu Zheng', 'email': 'zheng.zhenyu@outlook.com', 'username': 'Kevin_Zheng'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-08 20:34:08.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/api_versions.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_keypairs.py'], 'message': "When no version given, default to v2.0

Currently horizon got broken when python-novaclient was upgraded,
because it doesn't specify a version, and this lead to max version being
picked, but not actually sending any version headers, thus leading to a
failed request, specifically when uploading keypairs.

We must ensure we still default it to v2.0 when using the client.
Only the CLI should default to the max version.
The current state is worse, defaults to max version but sending
no version headers, which is totally broken.

This patch ensures we default to v2.0, by picking the min_version.

Related-Bug: #1493207
Related-Bug: #1493205

Change-Id: I1040539dc2bc26c5609b756dbfe3c85a5503fc8e
"}]
commit_message:
When no version given, default to v2.0

Currently horizon got broken when python-novaclient was upgraded,
because it doesn't specify a version, and this lead to max version being
picked, but not actually sending any version headers, thus leading to a
failed request, specifically when uploading keypairs.

We must ensure we still default it to v2.0 when using the client.
Only the CLI should default to the max version.
The current state is worse, defaults to max version but sending
no version headers, which is totally broken.

This patch ensures we default to v2.0, by picking the min_version.

Related-Bug: #1493207
Related-Bug: #1493205

Change-Id: I1040539dc2bc26c5609b756dbfe3c85a5503fc8e

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-08 23:12:45.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/hardware/discovery.py', 'ceilometer/compute/discovery.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/agent/test_manager.py'], 'message': "remove duplicate log exception message

Currently, when we poll hardware related metrics, if Keystone(Apache) or
Nova is down, the central agent will print many exception logs such as:
ConnectionError: ('Connection aborted.', error(111, 'ECONNREFUSED'))
with very long stack trace, but they are all same information.

This is because when we poll metrics, we discover the resources first,
if succeed, then we cache it, if fail, we do not cache it. So in such case,
each metrics will fail at discover steps, then log exception each time.

And actually we have wrapped instance_get_all with a log decorator, which
means each metrics will log twice.

So this patch removes duplicate exception messages by adding a try...except
block in hardware discovery, if there is any exception, we just return an
empty list, so agent can record this result in cache. Finally the log file
will only have one full stack trace exception message for all the hardware
metrics.

The disadvantage of such change is that when Keystone and Nova suddenly become
OK, then we will lose some data can possible collect. But from another
perspective, if in a singe interval, some hardware metrics have data but some
not is not a consistent thing to end user, so I think in such case we drop some
part of data (especially it is in start process or unstable status) is acceptable.

Change-Id: I0045a556cde274be8e4ba6c155d3f59b4e0d5b2c
Closes-Bug: #1493057
"}]
commit_message:
remove duplicate log exception message

Currently, when we poll hardware related metrics, if Keystone(Apache) or
Nova is down, the central agent will print many exception logs such as:
ConnectionError: ('Connection aborted.', error(111, 'ECONNREFUSED'))
with very long stack trace, but they are all same information.

This is because when we poll metrics, we discover the resources first,
if succeed, then we cache it, if fail, we do not cache it. So in such case,
each metrics will fail at discover steps, then log exception each time.

And actually we have wrapped instance_get_all with a log decorator, which
means each metrics will log twice.

So this patch removes duplicate exception messages by adding a try...except
block in hardware discovery, if there is any exception, we just return an
empty list, so agent can record this result in cache. Finally the log file
will only have one full stack trace exception message for all the hardware
metrics.

The disadvantage of such change is that when Keystone and Nova suddenly become
OK, then we will lose some data can possible collect. But from another
perspective, if in a singe interval, some hardware metrics have data but some
not is not a consistent thing to end user, so I think in such case we drop some
part of data (especially it is in start process or unstable status) is acceptable.

Change-Id: I0045a556cde274be8e4ba6c155d3f59b4e0d5b2c
Closes-Bug: #1493057

commit_message:
do not generate meter links on resource-list

meter links are not accessible via resource_list and add significant
overhead to query. we shouldn't generate these anymore.

Change-Id: Ib20f410a70171aa09e4ebbbb748a5ce495fc6a43
Closes-Bug: #1493400

commit_message:
Split each formatter into separate modules

As we increase the number of formatters, it doesn't make sense to
cram each into a single module.  This patch splits them up by
output format type.

Any new formatter should also be implemented as a separate module.

Change-Id: Ibbd0edb9af06a52bef28804a6619a07f323931e6

commit_message:
Consider `--os-token` when using v2

The `_cache_schemas` call currently forces authentication even when the
`auth_token` and `os_image_url` are passed. Instead of handling forced
authentications, let the client use the passed arguments and
authenticate only once if needed.

This was not caught by the existing tests because the call to
`_cache_schemas` was mocked.

Change-Id: I93cec9a68cafc0992d14dab38114d03e25f1e5da
Closes-bug: #1490462

subject: Adds the ability to provide user certificates to HAProxy
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-09-03 18:37:01.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/handlers/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_ssl_key_create.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/haproxy_server/tasks/haproxy_ssl_configuration.yml'], 'message': "Adds the ability to provide user certificates to HAProxy

This change brings similar changes as this one targeting horizon:

i.e.:
* The server key/certificate (and optionally a CA cert) are
  distributed to all haproxy containers.

* Two new variables have been implemented for a user-provided
  server key and certificate:
  - haproxy_user_ssl_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>
  - haproxy_user_ssl_key: <path to cert on deployment host>
  If either of these is not defined, then the missing cert/key
  will be self generated on each container. No distribution
  of the self generated certificates accross all the hosts
  is planned.

* A new variable has been implemented for a user-provided CA
  certificate:
  - haproxy_user_ssl_ca_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>

* The 'haproxy_cert_regen' variable has been renamed
  to 'haproxy_ssl_self_signed_regen' to have the same
  naming convention as horizon.

* A change of certificates, whether user dropped
  or role generated, triggers pem generation and server restart

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1487380

Change-Id: I0c88d197d8ede820ac4e0388e67a2da06b003c2b
"}]
commit_message:
Adds the ability to provide user certificates to HAProxy

This change brings similar changes as this one targeting horizon:

i.e.:
* The server key/certificate (and optionally a CA cert) are
  distributed to all haproxy containers.

* Two new variables have been implemented for a user-provided
  server key and certificate:
  - haproxy_user_ssl_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>
  - haproxy_user_ssl_key: <path to cert on deployment host>
  If either of these is not defined, then the missing cert/key
  will be self generated on each container. No distribution
  of the self generated certificates accross all the hosts
  is planned.

* A new variable has been implemented for a user-provided CA
  certificate:
  - haproxy_user_ssl_ca_cert: <path to cert on deployment host>

* The 'haproxy_cert_regen' variable has been renamed
  to 'haproxy_ssl_self_signed_regen' to have the same
  naming convention as horizon.

* A change of certificates, whether user dropped
  or role generated, triggers pem generation and server restart

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1487380

Change-Id: I0c88d197d8ede820ac4e0388e67a2da06b003c2b

commit_message:
Handle NotFound  error for all _resolve_attributes

Some of resources have try/except logic in their _resolve_attribute
methods. This patch move this logic to one level up for handling it
resolve_all_attributes. It should allow avoid overhead coding in
resource with custom _resolve_attribute method.

Change-Id: Id564c8ccfb2bc42eb522fcac98e81054502cdc65

subject: Set the Ubuntu mirror used based on the environment
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-09-08 09:38:28.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh'], 'message': "Set the Ubuntu mirror used based on the environment

Apt updates/installs are the most common cause of build timeouts
within HP Cloud gate checks.

This patch changes both the AIO and the gate check from using the
Rackspace Ubuntu mirror for everything to:

1) The AIO bootstrap will use whichever mirror is already defined
   on the host operating system.

2) The gate check will use a known mirror which is defined per
   cloud provider. If the cloud provider is not known, or the
   script is being used outside of OpenStack-CI, then the gate
   checkwill fall back to using the AIO's mechanism.

The idea is to make use of an apt mirror that is as close to the
instance as possible in order to speed up apt updates and installs.

Closes-Bug: #1491749
Change-Id: Ia37100bc198b64b74f27ea98ec5956e7cf084883
"}]
commit_message:
Set the Ubuntu mirror used based on the environment

Apt updates/installs are the most common cause of build timeouts
within HP Cloud gate checks.

This patch changes both the AIO and the gate check from using the
Rackspace Ubuntu mirror for everything to:

1) The AIO bootstrap will use whichever mirror is already defined
   on the host operating system.

2) The gate check will use a known mirror which is defined per
   cloud provider. If the cloud provider is not known, or the
   script is being used outside of OpenStack-CI, then the gate
   checkwill fall back to using the AIO's mechanism.

The idea is to make use of an apt mirror that is as close to the
instance as possible in order to speed up apt updates and installs.

Closes-Bug: #1491749
Change-Id: Ia37100bc198b64b74f27ea98ec5956e7cf084883

commit_message:
Cleanup API version schema

There is "list API versions" schema for nova, and we will share the
part of it between "get API version" schema. Current schema contains
a lot of indents and it was difficult to make it with a single patch
for sharing. Maybe reviews will be also difficult. As the first step,
this patch separates the part of schema from "list API versions" one.
After that, "get API version" schema will reuse it later.

Change-Id: If711eaeb51ddca885a8df2fd3272ee8ea9ff2eaf

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-01 07:59:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/config.py'], 'message': 'Fix identity new endpoint_type options for old users

Recently new config options were introduced to specify the
endpoint_type for identity clients. New options are introduced
with deprecated opt of old config 'endpoint_type' which had the
default value as "publicURL" where new options has below default values.

'v2_admin_endpoint_type' - 'adminURL'
'v2_public_endpoint_type' - 'publicURL'
'v3_endpoint_type' - 'adminURL'

'v2_admin_endpoint_type' is being used for identity admin client
which previously used to have endpoint_type as 'adminURL' hard coded
(not using old config option "endpoint_type").

As 'v2_admin_endpoint_type' is also with deprecated opt of old config option,
this results to Tempest failure for old users with environment which has old
config "endpoint_type" with its default value(endpoint_type = publicURL)
because that value will be consider for 'v2_admin_endpoint_type' option.

Previously Tempest used to run successfully with setting in config as:
  endpoint_type = publicURL

We should not have deprecation opt on 'v2_admin_endpoint_type' and
'v3_endpoint_type' as they are introduced with new default values and replacing
hard coded value.

'v2_public_endpoint_type' option can be kept same to serve the deprecation of
old config options.

This commit fix the above issue.

Change-Id: I5a1c181148a968e63b53ae46bb9632ad4e013315
Closes-Bug: 1484127
Related-Bug: 1490816
'}]
commit_message:
Fix identity new endpoint_type options for old users

Recently new config options were introduced to specify the
endpoint_type for identity clients. New options are introduced
with deprecated opt of old config 'endpoint_type' which had the
default value as "publicURL" where new options has below default values.

'v2_admin_endpoint_type' - 'adminURL'
'v2_public_endpoint_type' - 'publicURL'
'v3_endpoint_type' - 'adminURL'

'v2_admin_endpoint_type' is being used for identity admin client
which previously used to have endpoint_type as 'adminURL' hard coded
(not using old config option "endpoint_type").

As 'v2_admin_endpoint_type' is also with deprecated opt of old config option,
this results to Tempest failure for old users with environment which has old
config "endpoint_type" with its default value(endpoint_type = publicURL)
because that value will be consider for 'v2_admin_endpoint_type' option.

Previously Tempest used to run successfully with setting in config as:
  endpoint_type = publicURL

We should not have deprecation opt on 'v2_admin_endpoint_type' and
'v3_endpoint_type' as they are introduced with new default values and replacing
hard coded value.

'v2_public_endpoint_type' option can be kept same to serve the deprecation of
old config options.

This commit fix the above issue.

Change-Id: I5a1c181148a968e63b53ae46bb9632ad4e013315
Closes-Bug: 1484127
Related-Bug: 1490816

commit_message:
Add seed to fqdn_rotate

This change adds an additional seed to the fqdn_rotate for the apache
logrotation delay. We have seen that without the seed, some
configurations result in not enough randomness resulting in the same
delay for all controllers. By adding a seed string, the fqdn_rotate
command provides a better result.

Change-Id: I76f106d85ac363708e9fe35b04e56b189de1407f
Closes-Bug: 1491576

due to missing build.ini file containing information where to download
sources.

commit_message:
Add seed to fqdn_rotate

This change adds an additional seed to the fqdn_rotate for the apache
logrotation delay. We have seen that without the seed, some
configurations result in not enough randomness resulting in the same
delay for all controllers. By adding a seed string, the fqdn_rotate
command provides a better result.

Change-Id: I76f106d85ac363708e9fe35b04e56b189de1407f
Closes-Bug: 1491576

metadata when user_data_format is SOFTWARE_CONFIG, because we
know it will be overwritten.

subject: Merge Server os-collect-config metadata on update
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-08 07:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/nova/test_server.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py'], 'message': 'Merge Server os-collect-config metadata on update

Currently if someone does this, then updates the stack,
we overwrite *all* the server metadata, which will be bad for
all user_data_format: SOFTWARE_CONFIG use-cases, because we want
the transport details to remain over updates, and for the
deployments list to be untouched.

  aserver:
    type: OS::Nova::Server
    metadata:
      foo: 123

Note that we make an effort to merge the os-collect-config data
because it may be valid to pass additional occ options via the
template, in addition to those created internally.

Currently we silently overwrite the "deployments" key, which is
consistent with what we do on create, but a validation check
would be a good addition to fail-fast if we're about to stomp
on a template provided key.

Change-Id: Icf6001dde0a7633f85f5c306e31454d6457402da
Partial-Bug: #1488596
'}]
commit_message:
Merge Server os-collect-config metadata on update

Currently if someone does this, then updates the stack,
we overwrite *all* the server metadata, which will be bad for
all user_data_format: SOFTWARE_CONFIG use-cases, because we want
the transport details to remain over updates, and for the
deployments list to be untouched.

  aserver:
    type: OS::Nova::Server
    metadata:
      foo: 123

Note that we make an effort to merge the os-collect-config data
because it may be valid to pass additional occ options via the
template, in addition to those created internally.

Currently we silently overwrite the "deployments" key, which is
consistent with what we do on create, but a validation check
would be a good addition to fail-fast if we're about to stomp
on a template provided key.

Change-Id: Icf6001dde0a7633f85f5c306e31454d6457402da
Partial-Bug: #1488596

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-09 08:24:09.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_clusters.py', 'senlin/policies/scaling_policy.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/policies/test_scaling_policy.py'], 'message': 'Fix a bug in cluster scale in action

This patch revises the size calculation logic of ScalingPolicy. Now
the adjustment count from user should always be positive no matter
which event the ScalingPolicy targets on. And the output count of

Change-Id: I51c6ddebf7168e92e0dbc55ab9568352e20732ee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a bug in cluster scale in action

This patch revises the size calculation logic of ScalingPolicy. Now
the adjustment count from user should always be positive no matter
which event the ScalingPolicy targets on. And the output count of
creation/deletion field in policy data is also positive all the time.

Change-Id: I51c6ddebf7168e92e0dbc55ab9568352e20732ee

commit_message:
Add CLI option for update dry-run

When performing a stack-update using the --dry-run option will change
the output behavior. Instead of printing a list of stacks, the --dry-run
option will print the name, type, and action to be taken on resources in
the updated stack.

Docs change here https://review.openstack.org/132870/

Engine change here https://review.openstack.org/#/c/122473/

Implements: partial-blueprint update-dry-run

Co-Authored-By: Jason Dunsmore <jasondunsmore@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I3dd54084ce7bd5140b28e81b6eb2349123494de9

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq from failure during startup

Stagger the start times of the rabbitmq daemon so rabbitmq neither
crashes and also properly forms a cluster.  This problem exists in
the latest rabbitmq 3.5.4 available on rabbitmq.com for download.

Change-Id: Iac4186b3c3b586de38467294399c7ed9415244de
Closes-Bug: #1490780

commit_message:
Add ability to use custom config in DHCP-agent

This patch doesn't changes behaviour of dhcp-agent
but adds the opportunity to use user-defined config,
that will make dhcp-agent more flexible
and allows to run functional tests correctly
(without changing global oslo.config CONF)

Closes-Bug: #1492283
Change-Id: Ice807e8fc872b56bb3960b7a3de4110c7675d9d6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-02 10:50:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/utils.py'], 'message': "Add max_concurrent_builds limit configuration

Right now, nova-compute will attempt to build an infinite number of
instances, if asked to do so. This won't work on any machine, regardless
of the resources, if the number of instances is too large.

We could default this to zero to retain the current behavior, but
the current behavior is really not sane in any case, so I think we
should default to something. Ten instances for a single compute node
seems like as reasonable default. If you can do more than ten at a
time, you're definitely not running a cloud based on default config.

This is a backport from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153004

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable

Closes-Bug: #1418155

Change-Id: I412d2849fd16430e6926fc983c031babb7ad04d0
"}]
commit_message:
Add max_concurrent_builds limit configuration

Right now, nova-compute will attempt to build an infinite number of
instances, if asked to do so. This won't work on any machine, regardless
of the resources, if the number of instances is too large.

We could default this to zero to retain the current behavior, but
the current behavior is really not sane in any case, so I think we
should default to something. Ten instances for a single compute node
seems like as reasonable default. If you can do more than ten at a
time, you're definitely not running a cloud based on default config.

This is a backport from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153004

DocImpact: Adds a new configuration variable

Closes-Bug: #1418155

Change-Id: I412d2849fd16430e6926fc983c031babb7ad04d0

[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-08-21 17:46:25.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/proxy_logging.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_proxy_logging.py', 'doc/source/admin_guide.rst'], 'message': "Improving statistics sent to Graphite.

useful to display statistics organized by policy. Different policies may be
based on different storage properties (ie, faster disks).
With this change, all the statistics for object timers will be sent per policy
as well.
Policy statistics reporting will use policy index and the name in Graphite will
show as proxy-server.object.policy.<policy-index>.<verb>, etc.

aggregation.

Change-Id: Id70491e4833791a3fb8ff385953d69018514cd9c
"}]
commit_message:
Improving statistics sent to Graphite.

Currently, statistics are organized by command. However, it would also be
useful to display statistics organized by policy. Different policies may be
based on different storage properties (ie, faster disks).
With this change, all the statistics for object timers will be sent per policy
as well.
Policy statistics reporting will use policy index and the name in Graphite will
show as proxy-server.object.policy.<policy-index>.<verb>, etc.
Updated unit tests for per-policy stat reporting and added new unit tests for
invalid cases.
Updated documentation in the Administrator's Guide to reflect this new
aggregation.

Change-Id: Id70491e4833791a3fb8ff385953d69018514cd9c

and a new TokenClient became standard instead.
In Tempest unit tests, we are stubbing TokenClientJSON but it

Change-Id: I6404fd8215a619a90eaeea22afa479639d150872

commit_message:
Switch using token_client to the latest for gate

On tempest-lib 0.8.0, TokenClientJSON is marked as deprecated
and a new TokenClient became standard instead.
In Tempest unit tests, we are stubbing TokenClientJSON but it
doesn't work at all now.
This patch makes these unit tests switch to TokenClient for
passing the gate job.

Changed certificate order for pem generation with CA files

pem generation should always start from closer certificate
to the top of the chain. This commit fixes that.

Closes-Bug: #1493421

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-07 15:11:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/vm_util.py'], 'message': "VMWare: Check token in ResultSet before accessing 'propSet'

When multiple concurrent VM lifecycle operations are triggered,
RetrievePropertiesEx returns partial data under load in chunked manner.
Check ResultSets token attribute before accessing propSet attribute. If
token attribute exists and not empty, return None from _get_object_for_value
aiding _get_object_from_results to initiate a ContinueRetrievePropertiesEx.

Change-Id: I143e763ea48cfd64d653a8f8596e881f66cc1dcf
Closes-Bug: #1372708
"}]
commit_message:
VMWare: Check token in ResultSet before accessing 'propSet'

When multiple concurrent VM lifecycle operations are triggered,
RetrievePropertiesEx returns partial data under load in chunked manner.
Check ResultSets token attribute before accessing propSet attribute. If
token attribute exists and not empty, return None from _get_object_for_value
aiding _get_object_from_results to initiate a ContinueRetrievePropertiesEx.

Change-Id: I143e763ea48cfd64d653a8f8596e881f66cc1dcf
Closes-Bug: #1372708

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix snapshot delete for network disk type for blockRebase op

_volume_snapshot_delete was raising an exception as part of blockRebase
op when the new backing file happens to be None, which is a valid
scenario.

This patch ensures that we don't look for the libvirt disk spec (skip
calling _get_snap_dev()) if the new backing file for rebase op is
None.

Change-Id: I98deda75310f0b44b70257071d282aa50babe06b
Tested-By: Zhang Jinnan<zhang.jinnan@99cloud.net>
Closes-Bug: #1477110

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2417, 'name': 'Ben Swartzlander', 'email': 'ben@swartzlander.org', 'username': 'bswartz'}, {'_account_id': 8851, 'name': 'Valeriy Ponomaryov', 'email': 'kiparis.kh@gmail.com', 'username': 'vponomaryov'}, {'_account_id': 10621, 'name': 'NetApp CI', 'email': 'xdl-openstack-jenkins@netapp.com', 'username': 'netapp-ci', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 11811, 'name': 'HP Storage CI', 'email': 'hp.cinder.ci@external.groups.hp.com', 'username': 'hp-cinder-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13144, 'name': 'Oracle ZFSSA CI', 'username': 'oracle-zfssa-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18128, 'name': 'Microsoft Manila CI', 'email': 'Microsoft_Manila_CI@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_manila_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 14:32:55.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/lib_base.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/fakes.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/test_lib_base.py'], 'message': "NetApp cDOT driver with vserver creds can't create shares

With the new oversubscription-aware scheduler logic in Liberty,
the NetApp cDOT driver can no longer provision shares when the
driver only has vserver-scoped credentials.  This is because the
new scheduler logic requires the pool total size, whereas
previously the scheduler only needed the pool free space. Total
pool size is not available from cDOT when using vserver-scoped
credentials, so the driver must change to return 'unknown' in
that case and none of the free space checking or oversubscription
logic can be used.  When using cluster-scoped credentials, total
pool size is available and everything works fine.

Change-Id: I772fd8b133364439381a656ed84f9319b38eb135
Closes-Bug: 1490357
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver with vserver creds can't create shares

With the new oversubscription-aware scheduler logic in Liberty,
the NetApp cDOT driver can no longer provision shares when the
driver only has vserver-scoped credentials.  This is because the
new scheduler logic requires the pool total size, whereas
previously the scheduler only needed the pool free space. Total
pool size is not available from cDOT when using vserver-scoped
credentials, so the driver must change to return 'unknown' in
that case and none of the free space checking or oversubscription
logic can be used.  When using cluster-scoped credentials, total
pool size is available and everything works fine.

Change-Id: I772fd8b133364439381a656ed84f9319b38eb135
Closes-Bug: 1490357

subject: Use atomic_key for deployment metadata updates
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-25 02:48:17.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/service_software_config.py', 'heat/tests/test_engine_service.py', 'heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Use atomic_key for deployment metadata updates

This change switches _push_metadata_software_deployments over to
using db_api.resource_update for deployment resource metadata
updates.

Using the atomic_key filter of resource_update allows this code
to detect if another transaction has updated the metadata, and
the wrap_db_retry decorator is used to perform retry attempts. No actual
resource locking is required since we just need to detect if another
transaction performed an update, so the engine_id is not specified.

This change uses db_api directly rather than the Resource object since
this change will need to be backported to Kilo (db_api.resource_update
was created for convergence, and is in Kilo, but Resource object using
it is not). This change can switch back to using the Resource object once the
backport is complete.

This rows_updated/RetryRequest/wrap_db_retry technique is used by other
OpenStack projects for concurrent transaction detection (such as nova,
for floating IP allocation).

Cherry-picked and adapted from heat d43388358dd2d22af1e5b2b979a3e0755952023c
Change-Id: Ibf9dd58a66a77d9ae9d4b519b0f11567977f416c
Closes-Bug: #1477329
'}]
commit_message:
Use atomic_key for deployment metadata updates

This change switches _push_metadata_software_deployments over to
using db_api.resource_update for deployment resource metadata
updates.

Using the atomic_key filter of resource_update allows this code
to detect if another transaction has updated the metadata, and
the wrap_db_retry decorator is used to perform retry attempts. No actual
resource locking is required since we just need to detect if another
transaction performed an update, so the engine_id is not specified.

This change uses db_api directly rather than the Resource object since
this change will need to be backported to Kilo (db_api.resource_update
was created for convergence, and is in Kilo, but Resource object using
it is not). This change can switch back to using the Resource object once the
backport is complete.

This rows_updated/RetryRequest/wrap_db_retry technique is used by other
OpenStack projects for concurrent transaction detection (such as nova,
for floating IP allocation).

Cherry-picked and adapted from heat d43388358dd2d22af1e5b2b979a3e0755952023c
Change-Id: Ibf9dd58a66a77d9ae9d4b519b0f11567977f416c
Closes-Bug: #1477329

commit_message:
Always commit after deployment db operations

This should eliminate a potential race where a depolyment
create doesn't get commited before another engine calls
SoftwareConfigService._refresh_software_deployment

This change also adds a functional test which creates
4 parallel deployments to a server and assert that all 4 end
up in the server metadata.

Cherry-picked from 95e7389f9d4a81da27c95493b6dfc130e114f57d
Change-Id: Iab26aa10bddf3ea569e3ed83a973bcf968964b62
Related-Bug: #1477329

commit_message:
Replace SortedDict with OrderedDict

From django V1.9 django.utils.datastructures.SortedDict
will be removed and it is deprecated in V1.7.

The similar functionality is added in collections.OrderedDict
from python 2.7.

Horizon code also should avoid the SortedDict class and
start using the OrderedDict class.

This patch replacing the SortedDict with OrderedDict.

Change-Id: I8dfcf7c29fc49b6215451f160cf7a951bf11b5ad
Closes-Bug: #1492270

commit_message:
Add APIs for RAID configuration

This commit makes the following changes in the Ironic API:

1) Adds PUT /v1/nodes/NNNN/states/raid which helps to set
   node.target_raid_config.

2) Adds GET /v1/drivers/DDDD/raid/logical_disk_properties
   to retrieve the properties for logical disks that can be
   provided for a node with the driver DDD while setting
   target RAID configuration.

3) Modifies the API endpoints GET /v1/nodes/NNNN and
   GET /v1/nodes/NNNN/states to return node.raid_config and
   node.target_raid_config.

It also bumps the API version to 1.12.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: I806f79d997fab6af9a3640fd69815cadec6cae6b
Implements: blueprint ironic-generic-raid-interface

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 15:00:28.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py', 'neutron/policy.py', 'etc/policy.json', 'neutron/tests/etc/policy.json'], 'message': "Stop device_owner from being set to 'network:*'

This patch adjusts the FieldCheck class in the policy engine to
allow a regex rule. It then leverages that to prevent users from
setting the device_owner field to anything that starts with
'network:' on networks which they do not own.

This policy adjustment is necessary because any ports with a
device_owner that starts with 'network:' will not have any security
group rules applied because it is assumed they are trusted network
devices (e.g. router ports, DHCP ports, etc). These security rules
include the anti-spoofing protection for DHCP, IPv6 ICMP messages,
and IP headers.

Without this policy adjustment, tenants can abuse this trust when
connected to a shared network with other tenants by setting their
VM port's device_owner field to 'network:<anything>' and hijack other
tenants' traffic via DHCP spoofing or MAC/IP spoofing.

Closes-Bug: #1489111
Change-Id: Ia64cf16142e0e4be44b5b0ed72c8e00792d770f9
(cherry picked from commit 959a2f28cbbfc309381ea9ffb55090da6fb9c78f)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop device_owner from being set to 'network:*'

This patch adjusts the FieldCheck class in the policy engine to
allow a regex rule. It then leverages that to prevent users from
setting the device_owner field to anything that starts with
'network:' on networks which they do not own.

This policy adjustment is necessary because any ports with a
device_owner that starts with 'network:' will not have any security
group rules applied because it is assumed they are trusted network
devices (e.g. router ports, DHCP ports, etc). These security rules
include the anti-spoofing protection for DHCP, IPv6 ICMP messages,
and IP headers.

Without this policy adjustment, tenants can abuse this trust when
connected to a shared network with other tenants by setting their
VM port's device_owner field to 'network:<anything>' and hijack other
tenants' traffic via DHCP spoofing or MAC/IP spoofing.

Closes-Bug: #1489111
Change-Id: Ia64cf16142e0e4be44b5b0ed72c8e00792d770f9
(cherry picked from commit 959a2f28cbbfc309381ea9ffb55090da6fb9c78f)

subject: Don't run swift on ironic jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-02 17:46:49.000000000', 'files': ['features.yaml'], 'message': 'Don't run swift on ironic jobs

Ironic jobs are under a lot of memory pressure because they need to
launch 1GB VM's to fit the ramdisk or whatever special sauce is needed
to make the vm act like a real computer. Accordingly to facilitate
running as many of "guests" as possible we should limit the number of
services we're starting so we have more free ram. This commit removes
swift in an effort to do this. It also has the added benefit of
running less tempest tests on ironic jobs which will make it slightly
faster, which is another concern since the jobs are run serially.

Change-Id: Id1631e538a10fdcb0e96f5100133836b4d3f3e0e
'}]
commit_message:
Don't run swift on ironic jobs

Ironic jobs are under a lot of memory pressure because they need to
launch 1GB VM's to fit the ramdisk or whatever special sauce is needed
to make the vm act like a real computer. Accordingly to facilitate
running as many of "guests" as possible we should limit the number of
services we're starting so we have more free ram. This commit removes
swift in an effort to do this. It also has the added benefit of
running less tempest tests on ironic jobs which will make it slightly
faster, which is another concern since the jobs are run serially.

Change-Id: Id1631e538a10fdcb0e96f5100133836b4d3f3e0e

commit_message:
Fix a bug for "Set Gateway" form modal

When set gateway for a router having no name, it cast error:
"This field is required" for the router name. So there
should display the router's name_or_id in "Set Gateway"
form modal, and this is consistent with the "Edit Router".

Change-Id: Ibfcbf90f20c2eeb8b5533f8f41d4efc68df3ffbb
Closes-Bug: #1492667

commit_message:
Switch total_resources to use stack_count_total_resources

This change uses database queries to count the total number of
resources in a nested stack tree instead of loading every stack
and every resource in that stack.

This should result in a significant improvement in memory use
for stacks with many nested stacks and resources.

Cherry-picked from heat ca32acbecea28f3674ac59738d74966ed406f465
Closes-Bug: #1455589
Change-Id: I8c2f1fa9114dbf68ad4a5f99dd3929b6958b5d7a

commit_message:
Add py34 env to default tox run

Also, change order of envs in default tox run to avoid some errors
when running tox for the first time on fresh clone:
- run pypy first to avoid "No module _bsddb" error
- run py34 before py2x to avoid LP bug #1489059

Change-Id: I777c55077edb5d4f09518acf35366af97de3943f
Closes-Bug: #1492123

commit_message:
Add a missing "not" in the Python libcloud tutorial.

The point of the script is to create an instance, give it networking
and deploy an app, if the project has an IP that is in use it will try
to assign that IP to the instance and fail(silently) so the instance
won't get an IP.

Change-Id: I7b9ff513c4eac5e2830e57f12e09840159980e07

commit_message:
[RFC]Modify openstackclient to work on identity v3 API

This is doc-tool modification, NOT xml file changes.
Some subcommands (like openstack domain) required
to run with following option "--os-identity-api-version 3"
I guess with this changes. #1477935 will be fixed.

Change-Id: If81990198ca9f1f93d9bdd7069899368bada41cc
Relate-Bug: #1477935

subject: Fix unexpected exception thrown in unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-06 02:34:39.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix unexpected exception thrown in unit tests

During DataSourceDriver initiation, 'self.register_translator(translator)' will
validate the translators, throw exceptions if errors are detected, and
terminate instance initiation. But this PARTIAL INITIATION will cause problems
because 'self.poll_loop' is already spawned. 'self.poll_loop' uses
'self.running' which is defined in the parent class, which isn't initiated
because of PARTIAL INITIATION. So unexpected exception will be thrown.

Above problem happens in
test_datasource_driver.TestDatasourceDriver.test_get_schema_with_table_reuse().
Unexpected exception can be seen using './run_test.sh -d'.

Change-Id: Ia1d53861874c29410c1dd66db371a64efc5974d4
Closes-Bug: #1491209
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unexpected exception thrown in unit tests

During DataSourceDriver initiation, 'self.register_translator(translator)' will
validate the translators, throw exceptions if errors are detected, and
terminate instance initiation. But this PARTIAL INITIATION will cause problems
because 'self.poll_loop' is already spawned. 'self.poll_loop' uses
'self.running' which is defined in the parent class, which isn't initiated
because of PARTIAL INITIATION. So unexpected exception will be thrown.

Above problem happens in
test_datasource_driver.TestDatasourceDriver.test_get_schema_with_table_reuse().
Unexpected exception can be seen using './run_test.sh -d'.

Change-Id: Ia1d53861874c29410c1dd66db371a64efc5974d4
Closes-Bug: #1491209

commit_message:
Compatibility fix for pyscss 1.3.4

This commit alters the action-list.scss file so it is compatible
with the newer version of pyScss (1.3.4+), allowing us to
upgrade to that version.

This change is a prerequisite for the update to get into the
global requirements so that that change can pass testing.

Change-Id: Idec7ce039b57476ce20b7b678431459c2ca0bdbf
Co-Authored-By: Kelly Domico <kelly.domico@hp.com>
(cherry picked from commit cca93ade7c23c1f2794376161b6660a459292eee)

commit_message:
Support use_autoconfig in sahara cluster templates

use_autoconfig parameter when creating cluster templates.
This patch adds support for this feature to
OS::Sahara::ClusterTemplate resource in Heat.

subject: Redo function that pulls translations from Zanata
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-08 17:10:45.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update_django_openstack_auth.sh', 'jenkins/jobs/translation-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update_manuals.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update_horizon.sh'], 'message': 'Redo function that pulls translations from Zanata

The existing function pull_from_zanata would only work for the simple
Python project case of pulling translations from Zanata -- with only
locales directory and trivial rules to apply, with no real hope of
working for Horizon or OpenStack Manuals, given the current
functionality of the Zanata CLI utility.

Rewrite it to download every translation from Zanata and perform some
checks by hand if we keep the file or remove it. This also required
refactoring a large portion of cleanup_po_files so both functions could
leverage the same code.  OpenStack Manuals treats downloaded
translations sufficiently different that a similar function was required.

This also adds full support for Horizon and OpenStack Manuals projects,
including jobs, as well as new job templates to make it easier to
transition projects to pulling from Zanata. Adding -zanata jobs for the
Python projects and django_openstack_auth is not required, they are
already present.

Change-Id: I5b9f2eca7f099c56057fc5d09b4bbfe5ea5c596d
'}]
commit_message:
Redo function that pulls translations from Zanata

The existing function pull_from_zanata would only work for the simple
Python project case of pulling translations from Zanata -- with only
locales directory and trivial rules to apply, with no real hope of
working for Horizon or OpenStack Manuals, given the current
functionality of the Zanata CLI utility.

Rewrite it to download every translation from Zanata and perform some
checks by hand if we keep the file or remove it. This also required
refactoring a large portion of cleanup_po_files so both functions could
leverage the same code.  OpenStack Manuals treats downloaded
translations sufficiently different that a similar function was required.

This also adds full support for Horizon and OpenStack Manuals projects,
including jobs, as well as new job templates to make it easier to
transition projects to pulling from Zanata. Adding -zanata jobs for the
Python projects and django_openstack_auth is not required, they are
already present.

Change-Id: I5b9f2eca7f099c56057fc5d09b4bbfe5ea5c596d

commit_message:
Wait for metadata actually set to server

It is possible that at the time when deployment set its
resource_id metadata will not actually be set at the server. Wait until
metadata actually set at the server. This patch makes test more stable.

Change-Id: Iba8c1c47b0cb78798a1c46a3daef5cb3cc3cc9a2

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-08 14:30:10.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_federation.py', 'keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py'], 'message': "Remove padding from Fernet tokens

Fernet tokens were previously percent encoded. This can cause issues with
clients doing their own encoding or not. By removing the padding and then
re-establishing it when we validate the token, we don't present that problem to
clients. This also shortens the length of a Fernet token.

Change-Id: I674bad86ccc9027ac3b365c10b3b142fc9d73c17
Related-Bug: 1433372
Closes-Bug: 1491926
"}]
commit_message:
Remove padding from Fernet tokens

Fernet tokens were previously percent encoded. This can cause issues with
clients doing their own encoding or not. By removing the padding and then
re-establishing it when we validate the token, we don't present that problem to
clients. This also shortens the length of a Fernet token.

Change-Id: I674bad86ccc9027ac3b365c10b3b142fc9d73c17
Related-Bug: 1433372
Closes-Bug: 1491926

commit_message:
Update tempest configuration

This patch updates tempest configuration settings to move or
remove deprecated options, remove settings that are the same
as the default values, and re-order the settings to be in the
same order as the sample configuration file for easier
debugging.

Change-Id: Icefb5d4bf8a29a1e301ba5a8a74f5aa293a4fb13
Closes-Bug: #1482364
(cherry picked from commit 3c9454c86bd8770f753e84200692a6bc0840fc10)

commit_message:
Manually set token_endpoint options

OSC uses it's own plugin and set of options for token_endpoint
authentication which have different options to the keystoneclient one.
Hard set this to be what OSC expects for now.

Closes-Bug: #1484373
Change-Id: I16fa2cbd0b9c6e8a70b9a10c0e17de64f40bb935

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent traffic description in Flavors section

"Inbound traffic should be 128Mbps(16384 kilobytes/second)
Inbound peak should be 256Mbps (32768 kilobytes/second)"
which can be be consistent with the cmd examples.
And burst values are in kilobytes.

Change-Id: Ieeb3757ed2b49759fc7ea4cef3d5e23a0570ce78
Closes-bug: #1492876

In OVS Agent rpc_loop() resync mechanism clears the registered ports and
rescans them again, and it might result in missing some "port removed"
event and treat_devices_removed will not be called.

This fix rescans the newly updated ports when resync mechanism called,

'}]
commit_message:
ovs agent resync may miss port remove event

In OVS Agent rpc_loop() resync mechanism clears the registered ports and
rescans them again, and it might result in missing some "port removed"
event and treat_devices_removed will not be called.

This fix rescans the newly updated ports when resync mechanism called,
without clearing the current registered ports.

The registered ports will be cleared only if there are too many
consecutive resyncs to avoid resycing forever because of the same
faulty port.

Closes-Bug: #1329223

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Epifanov <aepifanov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gandharva S <gandharva.s@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Romil Gupta <romilg@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rossella Sblendido <rsblendido@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ib0db9dcf889d9fd90b623857782c9a6b091e18f5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-08 15:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'neutron/api/v2/attributes.py', 'neutron/policy.py', 'etc/policy.json', 'neutron/tests/etc/policy.json'], 'message': "Stop device_owner from being set to 'network:*'

This patch adjusts the FieldCheck class in the policy engine to
allow a regex rule. It then leverages that to prevent users from
setting the device_owner field to anything that starts with
'network:' on networks which they do not own.

This policy adjustment is necessary because any ports with a
device_owner that starts with 'network:' will not have any security
group rules applied because it is assumed they are trusted network
devices (e.g. router ports, DHCP ports, etc). These security rules
include the anti-spoofing protection for DHCP, IPv6 ICMP messages,
and IP headers.

Without this policy adjustment, tenants can abuse this trust when
connected to a shared network with other tenants by setting their
VM port's device_owner field to 'network:<anything>' and hijack other
tenants' traffic via DHCP spoofing or MAC/IP spoofing.

Closes-Bug: #1489111
Change-Id: Ia64cf16142e0e4be44b5b0ed72c8e00792d770f9
"}]
commit_message:
Stop device_owner from being set to 'network:*'

This patch adjusts the FieldCheck class in the policy engine to
allow a regex rule. It then leverages that to prevent users from
setting the device_owner field to anything that starts with
'network:' on networks which they do not own.

This policy adjustment is necessary because any ports with a
device_owner that starts with 'network:' will not have any security
group rules applied because it is assumed they are trusted network
devices (e.g. router ports, DHCP ports, etc). These security rules
include the anti-spoofing protection for DHCP, IPv6 ICMP messages,
and IP headers.

Without this policy adjustment, tenants can abuse this trust when
connected to a shared network with other tenants by setting their
VM port's device_owner field to 'network:<anything>' and hijack other
tenants' traffic via DHCP spoofing or MAC/IP spoofing.

Closes-Bug: #1489111
Change-Id: Ia64cf16142e0e4be44b5b0ed72c8e00792d770f9

commit_message:
Support for child resource extensions

Child resource extension classes will have to add a new class member,
parent_resource, with new formatting for object_path and
resource_path to take into account parent_id. An example class is
shown in the unit test.

Change-Id: Ie8f875edd341cac2f7af8fd286ae38d2d93e2a04
Closes-Bug: 1446428

commit_message:
Allow only GET on Root controller

This patch simply ensures a 405 error is returned when a HTTP
method different from GET is invoked on '/'.
This differs from the eventlet WSGI server behaviour; however
returning the same response as for a GET for any method, even
made up ones - like 'meh' - is a mistake that should not be
repeated in the Pecan WSGI server.

Change-Id: I4305f374e4aacab718daa6f131f278cc69e8d699

commit_message:
Fixed filters for functional tests

Removed filter for unused tee utility.
CommandFilter for curl replaced with more stricted RegExpFilter
and now allow run curl only with specified parameters.

Change-Id: I5d151a63f85cb969f79d4d92f5422e8e88855be5
Closes-Bug: #1487139

vCenter server version 5.1 does not support Storage Policy Based

'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix re-attach volume error for VC 5.1

vCenter server version 5.1 does not support Storage Policy Based
Management. This patch adds a check before retrieving storage profiles
which depends on SPBM. Storage profiles are used to check datastore
compliance.

Change-Id: Iba465becdc3e7bac2f47c3984ea42cc6537911ae
Closes-Bug: #1479402

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-08 06:48:36.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Improve the ability to resolve capability value

Improve the ability to resolve capability value if user input
unexpected but correct value to become more robust.

Resolve the multiple values:
User might input multiple values like
'capabilities': 'cap1:value1, cap2:value2'
This is not subject to the format of "k1:v1,k2:v2" but should be
accepted.

Depends: Ibfee071e7cc3226440f2e860ddf7b759527657c9
Change-Id: Ie52291a260a5a04279c4f21e52961226282c450b
'}]
commit_message:
Improve the ability to resolve capability value

Improve the ability to resolve capability value if user input
unexpected but correct value to become more robust.

Resolve the multiple values:
User might input multiple values like
'capabilities': 'cap1:value1, cap2:value2'
This is not subject to the format of "k1:v1,k2:v2" but should be
accepted.

Depends: Ibfee071e7cc3226440f2e860ddf7b759527657c9
Change-Id: Ie52291a260a5a04279c4f21e52961226282c450b

subject: Handle missing is_whole_disk_image in pxe._build_pxe_config_options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-07 13:39:37.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/pxe.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_pxe.py'], 'message': "Handle missing is_whole_disk_image in pxe._build_pxe_config_options

This commit handles the situation when 'is_whole_disk_image'
is not set in node.driver_internal_info and kernel/ramdisk
is missing in node.instance_info when
pxe._build_pxe_config_options is called.  This can happen when
prepare_ramdisk() is called on a node managed by agent_* driver
that is transitioning from 'manage' to 'available' state for the
first time (after being enrolled).

Change-Id: I6cac1beadc9177dd0cc28bdff7f30a6b3900ec98
Closes-Bug: 1492998
"}]
commit_message:
Handle missing is_whole_disk_image in pxe._build_pxe_config_options

This commit handles the situation when 'is_whole_disk_image'
is not set in node.driver_internal_info and kernel/ramdisk
is missing in node.instance_info when
pxe._build_pxe_config_options is called.  This can happen when
prepare_ramdisk() is called on a node managed by agent_* driver
that is transitioning from 'manage' to 'available' state for the
first time (after being enrolled).

Change-Id: I6cac1beadc9177dd0cc28bdff7f30a6b3900ec98
Closes-Bug: 1492998

commit_message:
Build oslo.context RequestContext

During the request, an oslo.context RequestContext is created.
This allows the log to contain the request ID as set by the
request_id middleware.

Change-Id: Ib27d91c20a58a48d611a7c0b42134f4970ff42a8
Closes-Bug: 1485604

auth context dict.

Make REPCONN return more sensical response codes.
Log errors in REPCONN handler.

Sneak in not calculating hashes for handoff replication, since I noticed I

commit_message:
go: improve replication logging

Make REPCONN return more sensical response codes.
Log errors in REPCONN handler.
Track and log files and amount of data transferred by replicator.
Sneak in not calculating hashes for handoff replication, since I noticed I
forgot that.

Change-Id: I6f0ceee0d0b5546f7e97574579d8445beec18248

commit_message:
Remove and deprecate conductor compute_node_create()

Now that the one and only call to create a compute node record in
resource tracker has been converted to objects[1], the old method
in conductor can be cleaned out.

[1] commit 2ef014eb313396cffb73fc52f5cea6b5a2151da7

Related to blueprint liberty-bump-object-and-rpcapi-versions

Change-Id: I6f8043efcc5928d7e42bc32b638bbd4e782a1e2a

commit_message:
Drop unused conductor manager vol_usage_update() mock

A recent change replaced calls to conductor method vol_usage_update()
with objects calls. One mock was mistakenly left in place and must be
removed before the method itself can be dropped in an upcoming
conductor rpc major version bump.

Change-Id: I2881189c904110a9f8aa85af266916d243de7586

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-08 05:22:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/context.py'], 'message': "Remove unused parameter overwrite in elevated

Nova uses overwrite in constructor of RequestContext to
update thread's local context or not, we don't need it
in method elevated, due to we never replace thread's local
context when get a copy with current context.

Change-Id: Ia85dfc4ddf4d4d31a7367c1ff90da118f503ba09
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused parameter overwrite in elevated

Nova uses overwrite in constructor of RequestContext to
update thread's local context or not, we don't need it
in method elevated, due to we never replace thread's local
context when get a copy with current context.

Change-Id: Ia85dfc4ddf4d4d31a7367c1ff90da118f503ba09

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: Ie57021baffb208babdfa42c72e4d5b4e8c2b1c18

commit_message:
Mongodb storing config overrides in /var/run

Mongodb currently writes configuration changes to '/var/run'
- not good location given that it's a volatile directory.

The overrides should be written next to the main configuration file in
/etc

Change-Id: Iaca9cc9e3ce1e6521839062fc9458c1b987f9464
Closes-Bug: 1485158

commit_message:
Bump the version of python-muranoclient to 0.7.0

A new release of muranoclient is out, having several new features
implemented. Other projects (such as murano-dashboard and murano
itslef) have to bump the minimum version of muranoclient to utilize
these features.
This patch bumps the minimum requirement and pins upper contraint to
the same value.

Change-Id: I270a9d8c321556db6da747e652d034b14390b83f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-04 09:59:23.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/heat-mesos-coreos/kubenode-coreos-mesos.yaml', 'magnum/templates/heat-mesos-coreos/elements/docker/mesos_bootstrap.sh', 'magnum/templates/heat-mesos-coreos/fragments/coreos.params.yaml', 'magnum/templates/heat-mesos-coreos/fragments/write-heat-params.yaml', 'magnum/templates/heat-mesos-coreos/kubecluster-coreos-mesos.yaml', 'magnum/templates/heat-mesos-coreos/elements/docker/Dockerfile', 'magnum/templates/heat-mesos-coreos/fragments/write-heat-params-master.yaml'], 'message': 'Initial Heat template for CoreOS Mesos cluster.

The template provisions a Mesos cluster with Marathon and Docker.
User should create a coreos-mesos cluster using below heat-templates.

A provisioned Mesos cluster consists of following processes running...
* Zookeeper: A distributed configuration and service discovery service.
* Mesos-master: A process for orchestrating the running of tasks on slaves.
* Marathon: A cluster-wide init and control system for services.
* Docker: The container engine.
* Mesos-slave: A process for running tasks.

Change-Id: I5fa28e812c3ff45e6f37c243a684a57b8e276e3b
Partial-Implements: blueprint mesos-bay-with-coreos
'}]
commit_message:
Initial Heat template for CoreOS Mesos cluster.

The template provisions a Mesos cluster with Marathon and Docker.
User should create a coreos-mesos cluster using below heat-templates.

A provisioned Mesos cluster consists of following processes running...
* Zookeeper: A distributed configuration and service discovery service.
* Mesos-master: A process for orchestrating the running of tasks on slaves.
* Marathon: A cluster-wide init and control system for services.
* Docker: The container engine.
* Mesos-slave: A process for running tasks.

Change-Id: I5fa28e812c3ff45e6f37c243a684a57b8e276e3b
Partial-Implements: blueprint mesos-bay-with-coreos

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-05 05:06:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'OVS agent: handle deleted ports on each rpc_loop iteration

Currently rpc loop processes ports only in case polling is required
(message from ovsdb monitor) or there are port_updated notifications from
server or security group notifications.
In case of just port_deleted notifications port processing is not
triggered during rpc loop.
This may lead to agent accumulating a big amount of deleted ports
and processing all of them at once during next iteration when polling is
required or any notification from server, which might be quite tough for
the agent. Tough means agent will be irresponsive while processing deleted
ports.
The patch makes port deletion processing more gradual.

Closes-Bug: #1491922
Change-Id: I0e1f6dfbf5b56fb18a978d6214e1768560d8ac98
'}]
commit_message:
OVS agent: handle deleted ports on each rpc_loop iteration

Currently rpc loop processes ports only in case polling is required
(message from ovsdb monitor) or there are port_updated notifications from
server or security group notifications.
In case of just port_deleted notifications port processing is not
triggered during rpc loop.
This may lead to agent accumulating a big amount of deleted ports
and processing all of them at once during next iteration when polling is
required or any notification from server, which might be quite tough for
the agent. Tough means agent will be irresponsive while processing deleted
ports.
The patch makes port deletion processing more gradual.

Closes-Bug: #1491922
Change-Id: I0e1f6dfbf5b56fb18a978d6214e1768560d8ac98

commit_message:
Added workflow handler and connected it to worker and deployer

Currently Solum uses notion of assembly quite extensively in
worker/shell.py and deployer/heat.py. While we are introducing
the new workflow resource and related objects, we want to ensure that
we can start using the workflow resource without having to wait for
complete overhaul of worker and deployer.

So to achieve this goal we have introduced an apapter class
in the workflow_handler. The adapter class provides a method to
create a plan and an assembly. This method is invoked upon each
POST to workflow. A one-to-one association is maintained between
each workflow and the corresponding created assembly.

Finally, to complete the end-to-end deployment we have introduced
a method in the deployer/heat.py to update the 'app' corresponding
to the invoked workflow with the status and the url of the
deployed application.

Change-Id: Ia08bf55f91d16ecc47e37b9dc1e8bae96a8141c3
Partial-Bug: #1486200
Co-Authored-By: ed--cranford (ed.cranford@gmail.com)

and plan models which are currently used quite extensively internally

heavy use of the assembly abstraction.

commit_message:
Adding workflow objects and models

While we are introducing the workflow resource and related objects, we
want to ensure that we remain backwards compatible with the assembly
and plan models which are currently used quite extensively internally
within Solum. Especially, the worker/shell.py and deployer/heat.py make
heavy use of the assembly abstraction.

With this patch we are adding a weak one-to-one association between
workflows and assemblies.

We have also introduced the workflow_table and have added some required
fields to the app table.

Change-Id: I3eed8f3515990b460bfeb3db07dac484edf543c8
Partial-bug: #1486200
Co-Authored-By: ed--cranford (ed.cranford@gmail.com)

subject: Properly handle port arguments for ICMP
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-03 18:06:57.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_security_group_rule.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/security_group.py'], 'message': "Properly handle port arguments for ICMP

The Compute API requires 'from_port' and 'to_port' to be -1 for
ICMP security group rules.  It happily accepts them empty or None
but the resulting rules do not work.  So we force the values for
ICMP rules.

Closes-bug: #1477629
Change-Id: Iba57211014caca16be7c9a28d15d4db2a6c51b8d
"}]
commit_message:
Properly handle port arguments for ICMP

The Compute API requires 'from_port' and 'to_port' to be -1 for
ICMP security group rules.  It happily accepts them empty or None
but the resulting rules do not work.  So we force the values for
ICMP rules.

Closes-bug: #1477629
Change-Id: Iba57211014caca16be7c9a28d15d4db2a6c51b8d

commit_message:
Modify test templates and the path to subunit2html

This patch contains the following two fixes
because the gate job fails if they are not applied
at the same time.

1) Use OS::Heat::TestResource in test templates

Use OS::Heat::TestResource instead of OS::Nova::Server
in heat_minimal.yaml and heat_minimal_hot.yaml

2) Update path to subunit2html in post_test_hook

Per:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/072982.html

The location of subunit2html changed on the images in the gate
so update the path used in the post_test_hook.

Long-term we should just use what's in devstack-gate.

Change-Id: I67acc3145719c3de1199e36c6667d975652d262f
Closes-Bug: #1492115
Closes-Bug: #1491646

commit_message:

commit_message:
Move Refstack project from stackforge to openstack-infra.

RefStack is a test result collection and reporting service to
support the DefCore testing process.  A patch [1] was submitted
to request for relocating the Refstack project to openstack-infra.
This patch updates the configuration files for the migration.
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/205609/

Change-Id: I161a93ef69908853f89c61bf8fc4fdb36a2919bc

commit_message:
Applies naming guidelines to service object

- Uses case and naming guideance to revise reference.
- Consider these as returning in a service catalog as "type"
  when a user asks for a service catalog.

Change-Id: I230235638c73c072bf86d76b9c991cb209029f64

commit_message:
Fixing oslo.serialization requirement

oslo.serialization released a new version today that requires a new version of
oslo.utils that we don't necessarily want yet.

Change-Id: I5b62ce7343b3ce87de1469c8781b424e7da26cce

commit_message:
Final decomposition of Cisco plugin

This patch follows the previous patch(listed as dependent) and moves
the remaining cisco db models from neutron to networking-cisco.
The patch deletes l3_model and cisco_router_plugin and their associated
config and helper files from neutron

Change-Id: I5b71e1dfb683e633e1cd11386dfb7c2ed7cc7d62
Partial-Bug: #1489609
